English: Before 1914 the Kingdom of Hungary regarded itself as a Great Power in its own right, as it constituted one half of the powerful Habsburg Dual-Monarchy. Victory in the Weltkrieg bought the Kingdom territorial gains at the expense of Serbia and Romania, but not the dominant position in the East that the Hungarians expected. While its agrarian economy has not fared well in the face of cheap grain from the new Eastern Kingdoms (particularly Ukraine), the political troubles in Austria and the weak Imperial authority under the adolescent Emperor Otto has allowed the Magyars to follow a more independent line.A Hungarian national army has been formed, and a new strain of aggressive and expansionist nationalism, determined to ‘Magyarise’ the divided peoples of the Balkans, has come to the fore of Hungarian politics. While German meddling in 1927 prevented the Hungarians from cementing their dominant position in the Dual Monarchy, the next Ausgleich renegotiation should be the time when the whole of the Crown Lands of St. Stephen will finally be restored to the Magyar nation.
French: Peu de temps après l’armistice de novembre 1918, la Hongrie est déclarée indépendante par le conseil national démocratique dirigé par le premier ministre Mihály Károlyi de Nagykároly. Les pays voisins dont la Roumanie et le jeune Royaume des Serbes, des Slovènes et des Croates saisissent alors leur chance de conquérir de nouveaux territoires. Des conflits internes relatifs à la constitution de la nouvelle République contraignent le gouvernement de Károlyi à démissionner pour céder la place à la coalition communiste et sociale-démocrate. La République des conseils hongroise est instaurée par le gouvernement de Béla Kun mais les tentatives de réforme sociale plongent rapidement le pays dans un climat de violents conflits. Les forces de la Restauration, soutenues par des troupes tchèques et roumaines, renversent en quelques mois la République, laissant le pays en proie à la “terreur blanche” qui coûtera la vie à de nombreux sympathisants de gauche. La situation demeure trouble. Après les élections de 1920, la Hongrie adopte une constitution intégrant à la fois des clauses autocratiques et parlementaires. On contourne le problème de l’accession au trône du dernier des Habsbourg, Charles IV, en recourant à un compromis. La place du monarque est occupée par un administrateur nommé par l’ancien amiral de la marine, Miklós Horthy. Dans le traité de paix de Trianon, signé en 1920, la Hongrie reconnaît officiellement les revendications territoriales d’un certain nombre de pays. Elle finit donc par céder la Slovaquie aux Tchécoslovaques, la Transylvanie aux Roumains et la Croatie ainsi que la Slovénie aux Yougoslaves. Après l’application du traité, la Hongrie perd 70 pour cent de son territoire et 65 pour cent de sa population. Tandis que Horthy profite de sa situation politique pour ôter tout pouvoir au parlement et persécuter les forces démocratiques, les défenseurs de Charles IV tentent, sans succès, deux coups d’Etat pour remettre le roi sur le trône. La politique de Horthy conduit droit à la Grande Dépression, doublée d’un certain nombre de tensions sociales. La réponse du chef de l’Etat consiste alors à nommer au poste de premier ministre, le conservateur Gyula Hömbös (1932-1936) qui procède immédiatement à un rapprochement avec l’Allemagne nazie et l’Italie fasciste.
Italian: Subito dopo l'armistizio del novembre 1918, un consiglio nazionale democratico guidato dal primo ministro Mihály Count Károlyi, proclamò l'Ungheria una repubblica indipendente. Gli stati confinanti, specialmente la Romania e il nuovo regno di Serbia, Slovenia e Croazia, approfittarono dell'occasione per mettere a segno delle conquiste territoriali. Le dispute interne sul progetto futuro della repubblica, costrinsero il governo di Károlyi a dimettersi in favore del partito socialista ungherese, una coalizione formata da comunisti e socialdemocratici. Sotto la guida di Béla Kun, venne instaurato un consiglio repubblicano. I tentativi di forzare le riforme sociali, portarono presto a violenti conflitti. Con l'aiuto delle truppe cecoslovacche e rumene, le forze della restaurazione riuscirono ad abbattere la repubblica in un paio di mesi, portando al 'terrore bianco' che costò la vita a molti sostenitori dell'ala di sinistra. La situazione rimase confusa. Dopo le elezioni del 1920, venne ratificata una costituzione contenente sia elementi autocratici che parlamentari. Il problema se nominare o meno re d'Ungheria l'ultimo discendente degli Asburgo, Carlo IV, fu risolto con un compromesso, nominando al posto di un monarca un amministratore, nella persona dell'ex ammiraglio della marina Miklós Horthy. Nel trattato di pace di Trianon (1920), l'Ungheria riconosceva formalmente molti diritti territoriali: la Slovacchia ai cecoslovacchi, il Siebenbürgen ai rumeni e la Croazia e la Slovenia agli jugoslavi. L'Ungheria perse il 70 percento del proprio territorio e il 65 percento della popolazione. Due colpi di stato nel 1921, tentarono invano di portare sul trono Carlo IV, mentre Horthy sfruttava la sua posizione per prendere il potere dal parlamento e perseguitare le forze democratiche. Alla grande depressione e alle tensioni sociali che l'accompagnarono, Horthy rispose nominando primo ministro l'ultra conservatore Gyula Hömbös (1932-1936) che avrebbe condotto il riavvicinamento dell'Ungheria alla Germania nazista e all'Italia fascista.
Spanish: Poco después del armisticio de noviembre de 1918, un consejo nacional democrático liderado por el Primer Ministro Mihály Károlyi declaró a Hungría república independiente. Los países vecinos, sobre todo Rumania y el nuevo reino de los serbios, eslovenos y croatas, se aprovecharon de la oportunidad para obtener beneficios territoriales. Disputas internas sobre el futuro diseño de la república forzaron la dimisión del gobierno de Károlyi y llegó al poder el Partido Socialista de Hungría, una coalición de comunistas y socialdemócratas. Bajo el liderazgo de Béla Kun se estableció una República de Consejos. Sin embargo, sus intentos de llevar a cabo reformas sociales pronto condujeron a violentos conflictos. Con la ayuda de tropas checoslovacas y rumanas, las fuerzas de restauración consiguieron aplastar a la República en cuestión de meses, lo que al principio llevó al 'terror blanco', que costó la vida a muchos partidarios de la izquierda política. La situación siguió siendo poco clara. Tras las elecciones de 1920 se ratificó una constitución que contenía elementos tanto autocráticos como parlamentarios. La cuestión de si el último de los Habsburgo, Carlos IV, iba a convertirse en rey de Hungría se resolvió con un compromiso. En lugar de un monarca, se nombró a un administrador: el antiguo almirante de marina Miklós Horthy. En el tratado de paz de Trianón de 1920, Hungría reconocía oficialmente muchas exigencias territoriales: la de Eslovaquia por parte de los checoslovacos, la de Transilvania por parte de Rumania y la de Croacia y Eslovenia por parte de Yugoslavia. Hungría había perdido el 70 por ciento de su territorio y el 65 por ciento de su población. Dos intentos de golpe de estado en 1921 con la intención de subir a Carlos IV al trono acabaron en fracaso, mientras que Horthy se aprovechó de su posición para arrebatarle poderes al parlamento y perseguir a las fuerzas democráticas. La reacción de Horthy a la Gran Depresión y a las tensiones sociales que la acompañaban fue nombrar primer ministro (1932-1936) al conservador Gyula Hömbös, que dirigió el acercamiento de Hungría a la Alemania nazi y la Italia fascista.
German: Kurz nach dem Waffenstillstand vom November 1918 deklarierte der demokratische Nationalrat unter Premierminister Mihály Count Károlyi die unabhängige Republik Ungarn. Die Nachbarländer, dabei besonders Rumänen und das neue Königreich der Serben, Slowenen und Kroaten nutzten diese Gelegenheit für Gebietseroberungen. Innenpolitische Streitigkeiten bezüglich der Zukunftspläne der Republik zwang die Regierung Károlyi zum Rücktritt, worauf die sozialistische Partei Ungarns – eine Koalition aus Kommunisten und Sozialdemokraten – an die Macht kam und unter der Führung von Béla Kun einen Volksrat schuf. Ihre Versuche, Sozialreformen zu erzwingen, führten jedoch schnell zu gewalttätigen Auseinandersetzungen: Mit Hilfe von tschechischen und rumänischen Truppen schafften es die restaurativen Kräfte, die Republik innerhalb von Monaten zu zerschmettern, wobei im Zuge des 'Weißen Terrors' viele Anhänger der politischen Linken ihr Leben ließen. Die Lage blieb unübersichtlich: Nach den Wahlen von 1920 wurde eine Verfassung ratifiziert, die sowohl autokratische als auch parlamentarische Elemente enthielt. Die Frage, ob der letzte Habsburger, Karl IV., als König von Ungarn gekrönt werden sollte, wurde mittels Kompromiss gelöst: Anstatt eines Monarchen wurde der ehemalige Marinegeneral Miklós Horthy als Verwalter ernannt. Im Friedensvertrag von Trianon von 1920 erkannte Ungarn viele ehemals eigene Gebietsansprüche an, nämlich die der Tschechoslowaken auf die Slowakei, die der Rumänen auf Siebenbürgern und die der Jugoslawen auf Kroatien und Slowenien. Ungarn hatte 70 Prozent seiner Fläche und 65 Prozent seiner Bevölkerung verloren. Zwei Putschversuche zur Entmachtung Karls IV. scheiterten 1921. Horthy nutzte seine Position dazu aus, um dem Parlament seine Macht zu rauben und demokratische Kräfte zu verfolgen. Horthy reagierte auf die Große Depression und die damit verbundenen gesellschaftlichen Spannungen mit der Ernennung des ultrakonservativen Gyula Hömbös zum Premierminister (1932 - 1936). Dieser sollte die Wiederannäherung Ungarns an Nazideutschland und an das faschistische Italien fortführen.

English: While the 'Peace with Honor' guaranteed Japan's rule of her overseas territories, most importantly Korea, the situation in Japan was already critical well before the end of Weltkrieg. Japan's once booming economy had turned to ashes immediately after the collapse of France and the gap between social classes continued to widen. Starting with the Rice Riot of 1918, the later period of the Taisho Era (1912-1926) witnessed severe economic crises and social conflict. Also one of the greatest natural disasters in human history happened, the Great Kanto Earthquake of 1923, which was then followed by an anarchist rebellion influenced by France's syndicalist revolution. After a failed attempt on Regent Hirohito's life by a lone anarchist, martial law was declared for the first time in Japanese history. General Tanaka Giichi (1864-1936) formed a cabinet with support from the Genro and Seiyuhonto (splinter groups of the Seiyukai), and then introduced the Peace Preservation Law which symbolized the Draconian rule of Tanaka. However, with collapse of the British Empire and with the economic depression in America, Japan's export-led economy continued free fall with no end in sight. 1926 saw a series of massive bank closures at home and German military intervention in China. As Tanaka was incapable to protect Japan's interest in China or stabilise financial system, the weakness of his rule was exposed. By April of that year, the two main opposition parties, Seiyukai and Kenseikai, formed a coalition and and started so-called 'the 2nd Movement to Protect the Constitution'. With popular support for the opposition and Prince Regent's indirect intervention, Tanaka was forced to resign. The coalition cabinet was formed, marking the beginning of democratic governance, universal suffrage and party-based cabinet. The coalition however, collapsed over the issue of intervention in Manchuria. Prime minister Inukai Tsuyoshi, and his Seiyukai cabinet, was determined to support Zhang Zuelin, the Warlord of Manchuria in an attempt to alleviate or resolve a number of economic difficulties, and prevent a complete German domination of China. On June 4 Japanese troops crossed the Manchurian border and quickly occupied all of Manchuria. Further advances were halted however due to diplomatic pressure emanating from Berlin. Nevertheless the success of the campaign helped to solidify the strong position of the military, most of whom felt the way forwards was to seek further conquests elsewhere. The chaotic year of 1926 ended with the death of Emperor Taisho and his son Hirohito assumed the throne. The next nine years saw mild economic recovery and peaceful political developments. Japan in 1936 is poised to extend her empire, with Germany's dominance of the world appearing to be in decline the Japanese look greedily at both the remaining Qing Chinese territories and the German pacific possessions.

General Tanaka Giichi (1864-1936) formed a cabinet with support from the Genro and Seiyuhonto (splinter groups of the Seiyukai), and then introduced the Peace Preservation Law which symbolized the Draconian rule of Tanaka. However, with collapse of the British Empire and with the economic depression in America, Japan's export-led economy continued free fall with no end in sight. 1926 saw a series of massive bank closures at home and German military intervention in China. As Tanaka was incapable to protect Japan's interest in China or stabilise financial system, the weakness of his rule was exposed. By April of that year, the two main opposition parties, Seiyukai and Kenseikai, formed a coalition and and started so-called 'the 2nd Movement to Protect the Constitution'. With popular support for the opposition and Prince Regent's indirect intervention, Tanaka was forced to resign. The coalition cabinet was formed, marking the beginning of democratic governance, universal suffrage and party-based cabinet. The coalition however, collapsed over the issue of intervention in Manchuria. Prime minister Inukai Tsuyoshi, and his Seiyukai cabinet, was determined to support Zhang Zuelin, the Warlord of Manchuria in an attempt to alleviate or resolve a number of economic difficulties, and prevent a complete German domination of China. On June 4 Japanese troops crossed the Manchurian border and quickly occupied all of Manchuria. Further advances were halted however due to diplomatic pressure emanating from Berlin. Nevertheless the success of the campaign helped to solidify the strong position of the military, most of whom felt the way forwards was to seek further conquests elsewhere. The chaotic year of 1926 ended with the death of Emperor Taisho and his son Hirohito assumed the throne. The next nine years saw mild economic recovery and peaceful political developments. Japan in 1936 is poised to extend her empire, with Germany's dominance of the world appearing to be in decline the Japanese look greedily at both the remaining Qing Chinese territories and the German pacific possessions.

English: Alash Orda occupies the lands of the former Steppe General Governorship of the Tsarist Empire. During the chaos of the civil war, a party of Kazakh nationalists successfully pushed for national independence, albeit granting considerable concessions and leeway to large numbers of ethnic Russian settlers in the region, and granting considerable autonomy to the Cossack garrisons. During the 1920s and early 1930s the country managed to improve it’s industrial base and to start creating it’s own army. Despite this, the position of the Orda is precarious. The Union of Turkestan to the South seeks to create a single Islamic Caliphate across the whole of Central Asia, and therefore poses an immediate threat. Additionally, while Russia has remained in a state of perpetual crisis for almost two decades, any Russian resurgence could be fatal - particularly if a new Russian government plays on the divided loyalties inherent within the Orda's ethnic groups.

Korea was a vassal of Qing Dynasty for centuries under the rule of the Joseon Dynasty. After the Treaty of Shimonoseki in 1895 which ended the Sino-Japanese War, Korea became nominally independent but in truth it was a puppet state of Japan. In 1897 Korea was proclaimed to be an Empire to show it’s freedom from Chinese rule although the state became more and more Japanese dominated. In 1910 Emperor Sunjong was forced to sign the Japan-Korea Annexation Treaty and resign. After that Korea became a part of the Japanese Empire and started to support oppressing the local culture. Due to that aggressive policy strong partisan forces were formed against the Japanese rule. Now, finally after many years, Korea is a free nation again. The question is: what it will start with its newly given freedom?

English: The General Governorship of Turkestan of the Russian Empire was a region marked by strong divisions, inhabited by ethnic Uzbeks, Kazakhs, Turkmen, Tajiks, Kyrgyz and Russians, and the site of the three historic Khanates of Khiva, Bukhara and Samarkand. The Civil War saw a brutal and intense conflict in the region, as a variety of local resistance groups fought both the remnants of the old Tsarist colonial administration and the new Tashkent Soviet. After several years of war, the increasingly radicalized native population coalesced around the Sufi-influenced 'Army of Islam' in the Fergana Valley. This movement had established rule through Sharia law in Samarkand, Bukhara and Tashkent by 1925, and by 1933 the whole of former Tsarist Turkestan was under its control. After three years of consolidation and internal reconstruction, the rulers of the new Federation of Turkestan are becoming restless. Many are wondering why the expansion of the state has now stopped and an increasingly influential Clerical faction are calling for the establishment of a new Islamic Caliphate over all of the former lands of Tamerlane...

From 1262 until 1380, Iceland acknowledged the sovereignty of the Norwegian Kingship.  When Denmark and Norway were separated in 1814, Iceland became a purely Danish dominion.  In the century that followed, Iceland gained increasing national autonomy, obtaining limited home rule in 1874 and almost complete home rule in 1903.  With the end of Iceland's personal union with the Danish crown, the island has become an independent nation for the first time in almost eight centuries.

The craddle of civilization, home to several ancient Empires, Mesopotamia was ruled by the Ottoman Turks since 1534 as the pashalik of Baghdad. By the 17th century, the frequent conflicts with the Safavid dinasty of Persia had sapped the strength of the Ottoman Empire and weakened its grip over those provinces, to the point it actually lost control over the area between 1508–1533 and 1622–1638. During the years 1747–1831, the region was ruled by Mamluk officers until 1831, when the Ottomans managed to overthrow their autonomy and imposed direct control again. Mesopotamia once again attracted world attention following the increase in Ottoman-German relations in the late 19th century, culminating in the beginning of the construction of the Berlin-Baghdad Railway, which wold give Germany access to the Red Sea port of Basrah. During the Weitkrieg, Mesopotamia was part of the Middle East Theatre, being a battleground between the Central Powers and the Entente until the final German-Ottoman offensive of 1920 - not before, however, the British-sponsored Arab Revolts awakened nationalist sentiments in the entire Arabian peninsula. Following the end of the war, the Berlin-Baghdad Railway was completed and the oil industry started to develop. Dissent against the Sultan in Constantinople would exist, however, until the final demise of the Ottoman Empire. With the help of foreign powers and inspired by the Arab Revolts of the Weitkried, and independent Iraq was declared.

India finally achieved its defacto independence in the aftermath of the British Revolution of 1925 as the Raj finally collapsed on itself. Rising to the mantle of governance was the Rajput maharaja of Bikaner, Ganga Singh whose authoritarian style of governing the newly freed Indian Dominion soon put him at odds with the leftist civilian opposition centred around the Indian National Congress and its militant underground supporters. Within months the INC’s denouncement of Singh’s negotiated Anglo-Indian Treaty brought the sub-continent to civil war. It was in this chaotic time that the southern princely states, citing the Anglo-Indian Treaty and numerous legal transgression of Ganga Singh as motivation, united behind Osman Ali Khan, the Nizam of Hyderabad, and declared him the true vice-roy of the Indian Dominion. As the civil war escalated into a confusing quagmire of violence Ali Khan failed to invade Singh’s northern power base, but succeeded in rooting out Socialist enclaves in Bombay and also prevented both the Delhi and Calcutta government from invading the Deccan Plateau. When peace finally came, the Princely Federation soon went about organizing a true nationalist successor government to the Raj, with Osman Ali Khan serving as Nizam-al-Mulk (Administrator of the Realm) and his fellow princes serving in an advisory as well as legislatively role in the so-called Council of Princes. By 1936, the Princely Federation is a brittle state, but never the less the closest India has to a conservative native government.

In the mid-19th century the Emerald Isle was economically weak and in perpetual crisis. Between 1845 and 1852 the potato harvest was completely destroyed and a famine known as The Great Hunger (an Gorta Mór) ravaged the land, leading to mass starvation and mass immigration of Irish to the United States. Gradually, voices for independence from the British Crown grew louder and louder. In 1914 Home Rule was supposed to be granted, but it was delayed with the outbreak of the Weltkrieg. Disappointment and simmering tensions culminated in the German-supported Easter Rising in 1916, though it was soon suppressed by the British Army. Continued unrest eventually ruptured into revolution, and in 1921 a peace treaty was finally signed between the Irish rebels and the British government. According to this treaty, all of Ireland was to be ruled from Dublin, the British-settled north was to receive special autonomous privileges, the new country was to be named the "Irish Free State", it would remain part of the British Empire, and the King would be the figurehead Head of State. The Free State was officially established on January 1st, 1922, and Michael Collins became its Taoiseach (Prime Minister). When the British Revolution occurred, Collins declared independence from Britain and dissolved the autonomy of the north. On October 24th, 1925, the Republic of Ireland was born. After a decade as President, in 1936 Collins still leads the nation without any serious opposition, riding on a wave of unbeatable public support. Officially its President, Michael Collins has become a de-facto dictator of the Irish Republic.

The unified Italy created in 1861 lasted little more than half a century. Her decision to side with the Entente powers rather than her traditional Central European allies during the Great War proved to be a mistake to the highest order. In 1919 Italy collapsed under a Central Powers' offensive, and the combination of anger at Italy's betrayal and the Austrian desire for a divided Italian peninsula led to the break-up of Italy as a nation. After three years of Austrian occupation a number of separate duchies were established in the north, grouped into a federation nominally headed by the Papacy, but with great regional autonomy. However in the early 1930's this began to change when a group of radical cardinals gained political control of the Vatican. Aided by Pope Pius XI this group pushed for the centralisation and expansion of Papal power and control over the federation. During this period Austria was distracted by internal affairs, and was reluctant to intervene in favour of the status quo. Playing on the massive popular support the Pope had and setting this in the context of needing a great leader to guard Italian Federation from the dangers of Syndicalism the Pope emerged as the formal leader of northern Italy in 1935. However, the Holy See must now face up to several challenges to its new power- ranging from the now demonised Syndicalist regimes to the south and west of the Federation, and also, having upset the balance of power, the Austrians. But opportunities beckon too - Carlists in Spain, Integralists in Brazil, even the mighty Zentrumspartei of Germany, are on the rise, and have always acknowledged the Spiritual Authority of the Heir of St. Peter…
French: L’Italie entre dans la Première Guerre mondiale avec l’espoir de conquérir des territoires austro-hongrois dans les Alpes et le long de l’Adriatique. Idéalement, elle souhaiterait même bénéficier du morcellement de l’Empire ottoman jugé alors comme un territoire moribond. Ses performances militaires se révèlent toutefois très décevantes et les puissances victorieuses se réunissant à Versailles lui cèdent moins de territoires qu’elle ne l’avait espéré. L’issue de cette guerre contribue donc à affaiblir davantage une démocratie en péril, ouvrant la voie, en 1922, à la tristement célèbre “Marche sur Rome” de Mussolini, qui instaure par la suite le premier régime fasciste dictatorial d’Europe. Afin de faire grimper la cote de popularité de son régime autocratique, Mussolini promet à son peuple de refaire de l’Italie une superpuissance. En 1936, il est prêt à conduire sa première attaque contre l’Abyssinie en espérant que la victoire permettra d’effacer la honte de la défaite italienne à Adoua, en 1898. Mussolini sait pourtant que cette attaque risque d’engendrer des conflits diplomatiques et il n’est pas certain que les modestes ressources industrielles italiennes supportent une guerre prolongée. Le sort de l’Italie fasciste demeure incertain...
Italian: L'Italia entrò nella Prima Guerra Mondiale con la speranza di ottenere territori sulle Alpi e lungo la costa adriatica dagli austro-ungarici, e forse di prendere parte all'invasione dell'impero ottomano ormai in declino. Le sue reali prestazioni in quella guerra, furono tuttavia sconcertanti, e la risoluzione di Versailles seguita all'armistizio, assegnò all'Italia molto meno di quanto si aspettava. Ciò contribuì a indebolire ulteriormente la già instabile democrazia parlamentare del paese, e a preparare la strada alla celebre marcia su Roma di Benito Mussolini (1922), che fece da preludio all'insediamento della prima dittatura fascista in Europa. Per accrescere il consenso del suo regime tirannico, Mussolini promise di fare nuovamente dell'Italia una grande potenza, di costruire un paese formidabile, forze aeree e navali, e di espandere l'impero coloniale italiano. Nel 1936, Mussolini ordinò un'offensiva contro l'Abissinia per cancellare la disonorevole sconfitta dell'Italia ad Adua nel 1898, ma quell'attacco ebbe sviluppi diplomatici controversi, e non era affatto chiaro se le modeste risorse industriali italiane fossero in grado di sostenere una guerra su vasta scala. Il destino dell'esperimento fascista italiano era quanto mai incerto.
Spanish: Italia entró en la Primera Guerra Mundial con grandes esperanzas de arrebatarle territorios en los Alpes y en la costa adriática al Imperio Austro-Húngaro y tal vez participar en la división del moribundo Imperio Otomano. Sin embargo, su actuación en esa guerra fue decepcionante y recibió menos de lo esperado en los acuerdos de Versalles que siguieron al Armisticio. Esto debilitó aún más su ya inestable democracia parlamentaria y abonó el terreno para la famosa 'Marcha sobre Roma' de Benito Mussolini en 1922, que ayudó a establecer la primera dictadura fascista de Europa. Para ayudar a reforzar la popularidad de su régimen autocrático, Mussolini prometió devolverle al país la condición de gran potencia, desarrollar un formidable ejército de tierra, mar y aire, y ampliar el imperio colonial italiano. En 1936 está preparado para dar su primer paso importante en esta campaña: una ofensiva contra los abisinios que eliminará (o eso espera) el ignominioso borrón de la derrota italiana de 1898 en Aduwa. Pero es seguro que este ataque será diplomáticamente controvertido, y no está nada claro que los modestos recursos industriales de Italia estén capacitados para mantener una guerra prolongada. La suerte del experimento fascista italiano es incierta.
German: Italien griff in den Ersten Weltkrieg mit hohen Erwartungen bezüglich Gebietsübernahmen in den Alpen und entlang der Adria von Österreich-Ungarn ein. Außerdem hoffte es, vielleicht sogar ein Stück vom Kuchen des morschen osmanischen Reiches abzubekommen. Seine tatsächliche Leistung in diesem Krieg war allerdings eher enttäuschend und es bekam im Vertrag von Versailles nach dem Waffenstillstand weit weniger zugesprochen, als es erhofft hatte. Dies schwächte die ohnehin schon belastete parlamentarische Demokratie des Landes noch weiter und bereitete den Weg für Benito Mussolinis berühmten 'Marsch auf Rom' von 1922 vor, der zur Einrichtung Europas erster faschistischer Diktatur führte. Um die Popularität seines autokratischen Regimes zu stärken versprach Mussolini, Italien wieder zu einer Großmacht zu machen, eindrucksvolle Streitkräfte zu Land, See und in der Luft aufzustellen und das italienische Kolonialreich zu erweitern. 1936 machte seine erfolgreiche Offensive gegen die Abessinier die unwürdige Niederlage bei Adowa von 1898 wieder gut, aber der Angriff riss eine gewaltige Kluft zwischen Italien und dem Westen auf. Soll Italien jetzt seinen Hut in den Ring werfen, da sich nun die Kriegswolken über Europa zusammenziehen? Kriegsbeute lockt, aber es ist noch lange nicht klar, ob Italiens bescheidene industrielle Ressourcen einen größeren Krieg tragen können. Das Schicksal des faschistischen Experiments in Italien ist ungewiss.

English: On March 3, 1918, Russia renounced its Baltic provinces in the Brest-Litovsk treaty. On March 8 and April 12, 1918 the local Baltic German-dominated Kurl?ndische Landesrat and the Vereinigter Landesrat of Livland, Estland, Riga, and ?sel had declared themselves independent states, known as the Duchy of Courland and Baltic State. The two formed the United Baltic Duchy (Vereinigtes Baltisches Herzogtum), a client state of the German Empire with Adolf Friendrich zu Mecklenburg for head of state. The Baltische Landeswehr, formed hastily by the Duchy's government, scored a number of victories against the British expeditionary force, local dissenting militias as well as the Bolshevik forces that tried to take over the Baltic in their campaign for a communist state. The United Baltic Duchy profited from the German economic boom due to its great integration with Berlin, but did not escape the downfall of the past few years. In the year 1936, the Eastern Rampart of the Empire sees itself in an ever more tense geopolitical climate. Interior ethnic tensions caused by an ever so radical government policy of bringing in German colonists, Finnish pretensions over Estland, Nordlivland and ?sel, vacillating loyalties of the eastern states that are not as supportive of the Kaiser as they used to and, finally, the vast Russian Republic with its increasing political instability all pose a threat to the Baltic state. Will the Eastern Rampart of the Empire hold fast?

Created in the early 19th century by freed African-Americans who either wanted to return to Africa to start a new life or were forced to leave, Liberia was to eventually earn the honor, alongside Ethiopia, of being the only independent countries in Africa. Since their declaration of independence from the Great Britain in 1846, Liberia has dealt peacefully with several border conflicts over the years with both France and Britain. The twentieth century has seen for Liberia many years of tension between the African-American colonists and the indigenous peoples of the area, with an international commission from the League of Nations investigating charges of slavery and forced labor in 1929. In the coming conflict Liberia will be an important part of the American war effort, as its rubber supply could be vital.
French: Le Liberia est créé au 19e siècle par des Afro-américains qui souhaitent retourner en Afrique pour mener une nouvelle vie, mais aussi par ceux qui ont été obligés de quitter les Etats-Unis. L’Ethiopie et le Libéria sont alors les seuls pays indépendants d’Afrique. Depuis son indépendance, déclarée officiellement en 1846, le Libéria a pacifiquement résolu les conflits frontaliers qui l’opposaient à la France ou à la Grande-Bretagne. Au cours du 20e siècle, le pays doit faire face à de nombreuses tensions opposant les colons afro-américains aux indigènes vivant dans la région. En 1929, la Société des Nations condamne l’esclavage et le travail forcé. Les ressources en caoutchouc du pays feront du Libéria un soutien vital pour les Alliés dans le conflit qui se prépare en Europe.
Italian: Creata all'inizio del diciannovesimo secolo dagli afro-americani liberi, desiderosi di tornare in Africa per iniziare una nuova vita, o dalla quale erano stati costretti a fuggire, la Liberia ebbe l'onore, insieme all'Etiopia, di essere l'unico paese indipendente in Africa. Dalla sua dichiarazione d'indipendenza dall'Inghilterra nel 1846, la Liberia ha affrontato pacificamente nel corso degli anni diversi conflitti presso i suoi confini, con inglesi e francesi. Il ventesimo secolo ha significato per il paese diversi anni di tensione, dovuti ai colonizzatori afro-americani e alla popolazione indigena della zona. Nel 1929, la lega delle nazioni nominò una commissione internazionale per far luce sulle accuse di schiavitù e costrizione ai lavori forzati. Nel conflitto che seguì, la Liberia avrebbe giocato un ruolo importante per gli sforzi degli alleati, dato che la sua riserva di gomma si sarebbe rivelata fondamentale.
Spanish: Creada a principios del siglo XIX por libertos afroamericanos que bien querían volver a África para iniciar una nueva vida o fueron obligados a marcharse, Liberia acabaría ganándose el honor de ser, junto con Etiopía, los únicos países libres de África. Desde su declaración de independencia de la Gran Bretaña en 1846, Liberia ha ido solucionando de manera pacífica varios conflictos fronterizos con Francia y el Reino Unido a lo largo de los años. El siglo XX le ha traído a Liberia muchos años de tensión entre los colonos afroamericanos y los indígenas de la zona, con una comisión de la Sociedad de Naciones investigando acusaciones de esclavitud y trabajos forzados en 1929. En el conflicto que se acerca, Liberia formará parte del esfuerzo de guerra aliado, ya que su producción de caucho puede resultar vital.
German: Liberia wurde im frühen 19. Jahrhundert von befreiten Afroamerikanern gegründet, die entweder in Afrika ein neues Leben beginnen wollten oder zum Verlassen Amerikas gezwungen worden waren, und war zusammen mit Äthiopien eines der beiden einzigen unabhängigen Länder Afrikas. Seit der Unabhängigkeitserklärung von Großbritannien 1846 hat sich Liberia auch in mehreren Grenzkonflikten sowohl gegen Frankreich als auch gegen England auf friedliche Weise behauptet. Das 20. Jahrhundert sah in Liberia viele Jahre der Spannungen zwischen afroamerikanischen Kolonisten und Eingeborenen. Eine internationale Kommission des Völkerbunds untersuchte 1929 Vorwürfe hinsichtlich Sklaverei und Zwangsarbeit. Im kommenden Konflikt wird Liberia zu einem wichtigen Teil der alliierten Kriegsbemühungen, da seine Gummivorräte sich als elementar erweisen könnten.

Kraj wywalczy³ sobie przywilej bycia jedynym, obok Etiopii, niepodleg³ym pañstwem afrykañskim. Od czasu od³¹czenia od korony brytyjskiej w 1846 roku, Liberia rozwi¹za³a pokojowo kilka konfliktów z Francj¹ i Wielk¹ Brytani¹. W dwudziestym wieku krajem wstrz¹sa³y wieloletnie konflikty pomiêdzy rdzennymi mieszkañcami, a czarnymi kolonistami. English: Following the Third Partition of Poland in 1795, Lithuania was split between the Russian Empire and Prussia, Russia getting most of the territory. After Napoleon's campaign in Russia ended in disaster, Tsar Nicholas I began an intensive program of Russification. The Lithuanians and Poles revolted twice, in 1831 and 1863, but both attempts failed. In 1864 the Lithuanian language and the Latin alphabet were banned in junior schools. Lithuanians resisted the Russification by arranging printing abroad and smuggling the books in. The national revival started among poor people in the late years of Russian occupation, then continued with the wealthy, beginning with the release of Lithuanian newspapers, Ausra and Varpas, then with the writing of poems and books in Lithuanian. These writings glorified the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, depicting the nation with power and many heroes. This revival spearheaded the independence movement, with various organizations opposing Russian influence. Russian policy became harsher in response and there are known to have been strikes against Catholic churches, while a ban of the Lithuanian press still continued. Despite Russian attempts to integrate Lithuania by the end of the 19th century Lithuania had developed a growing nationalist movement. During the Russia-wide revolutionary upsurge of 1905 a congress of Lithuanian representatives in Vilnius on 5 December 1905 demanded provincial autonomy. During Weltkreig Lithuania's occupation by Germany and the subsequent collapse of the Russian imperial government led to the proclamation of an independent republic on February 16, 1918 under German control, and full independence in November 1918. On the 11th of July 1918, King Mindaugas II (born as HSH Prince Wilhelm Karl Florestan Gero Crescentius of Urach, Count of Württemberg) was crowned as King of Lithuania. Lithuania Minor was kept under German control, and the border settled between the German Baltic state and Lithuania meant that that the latter would be deprived of any sea access. Mindaugas II was succeeded following his death on the 24th of March 1928 by his son, crowned Mindaugas III. Now, in 1936 the population is worried about continuing German influence in the Baltic and a "Speak Lithuanian!" movement has sprung up in fear of the events that have happened in the Baltic vassal to Germany to the north, so the king must decide between allegiance to the Lithuanian people or the Kaiser.
French: La Lituanie profite de la fragilisation de la Russie tsariste pour faire quelques pas vers l’indépendance. De 1905 à 1907, les Lituaniens deviennent de plus en plus autonomes et appellent à la création d’une assemblée constitutionnelle. Pendant la Première Guerre mondiale, le pays est occupé par les Allemands mais il déclare son indépendance en 1918, après la révolution russe. L’Armée Rouge marche sur Vilnius pour forcer la Lituanie à réintégrer la Russie mais l’intervention des troupes allemandes et polonaises permet au pays de conserver son intégrité politique. La Pologne annexe toutefois Vilnius pendant la guerre russo-polonaise de 1920. La domination polonaise est officialisée par un référendum en 1922. En 1923, la Lituanie annexe la région de Memel qui avait subi la domination prussienne jusqu’en 1919, suivie du gouvernement des Alliés. La conférence des ambassadeurs de l’Alliance officialise l’annexion mais garantit à la région une autonomie interne. La période qui suit la Grande Guerre est marquée par une crise nationale. Le gouvernement décide de procéder à une réforme terrienne en 1922. Celle-ci consiste à confisquer les terres des grands propriétaires afin de leur retirer leur pouvoir économique et politique. Des tensions sociales croissantes permettent à l’armée et au parti nationaliste dirigé par Tautinenkae de renverser le gouvernement existant en 1926. La constitution républicaine est révoquée, laissant place à un régime autoritaire dirigé par Antanas Smetona. En 1934, la Lituanie forme l’Entente Balte avec la Lettonie et l’Estonie.
Italian: Col diminuire del potere della Russia zarista, la Lituania si avviò lentamente verso l'indipendenza. Nel 1905/07, il paese ricevette un'autonomia parziale e organizzò un'assemblea costituzionale. Durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale, la Lituania fu occupata dai tedeschi, e dopo il successo della rivoluzione russa, proclamò la propria indipendenza nel 1918 come repubblica democratica. Ciò provocò la marcia dell'Armata Rossa su Vilnius nel tentativo di riportare il giovane stato nella Russia, ma l'intervento delle truppe tedesche e polacche consentì di conservare l'integrità della Lituania. Ciononostante, la Polonia finì con l'annettere Vilnius durante la guerra russo-polacca del 1920, annessione che venne poi sancita da un referendum nel 1922. Nel 1923, la Lituania ha annesso l'area del Memel, che fino al 1919 era rimasta sotto il governo prussiano, e da allora era stata amministrata dagli alleati. La conferenza degli ambasciatori alleati, riconobbe l'annessione ma insisteva per concedere l'autonomia interna alla regione. Il periodo seguente la Grande Guerra fu caratterizzato da una crisi interna lituana. Nel 1922, il governo avviò una riforma della terra, sottraendola ai grossi proprietari terrieri anche per assecondare la propria leadership economica e politica. La tensione sociale continuava ad aumentare portando, nel 1926, alla caduta del governo da parte dell'esercito e del partito di destra Tautinenkae. La costituzione repubblicana venne sostituita da un regime autoritario sotto Antanas Smetona. Nel 1934, è stata costituita l'intesa baltica con Lettonia ed Estonia.
Spanish: A medida que menguaba el poder de la Rusia zarista, Lituania fue avanzando con lentitud hacia la independencia. En 1905-07, recibió una autonomía parcial y se convocó una asamblea constitucional. Durante la Primera Guerra Mundial, el país fue ocupado por los alemanes y, tras el éxito de la Revolución Rusa, en 1918 declararon su independencia como república democrática. Esto hizo que el Ejército Rojo marchase sobre Vilna para devolver al joven estado al seno de Rusia, pero la intervención de las tropas alemanas y polacas preservó la integridad lituana. A pesar de todo, Polonia se anexionó Vilna durante la Guerra Ruso-polaca de 1920. Esta anexión fue reconocida en 1922 por medio de un referéndum. En 1923, Lituania se anexionó la zona de Memel, que hasta 1919 había estado en manos de Prusia y desde entonces había sido administrada por los Aliados. La conferencia de los embajadores de los Aliados reconoció la anexión, pero insistió en que la región debía tener una autonomía en asuntos internos. Los tiempos posteriores a la Gran Guerra en Lituania se vieron marcados por una crisis interna. El gobierno decidió una reforma agraria en 1922, expropiando tierras a los grandes terratenientes y arrebatándoles a la vez su liderato político y económico. Las tensiones sociales siguieron en aumento, hasta que el ejército y el derechista partido Tautinenkae derrocaron al gobierno en 1926. La constitución republicana fue derogada y se instauró un régimen autoritario bajo el liderazgo de Antanas Smetona. En 1934 se formó la Entente Báltica junto con Letonia y Estonia.
German: Mit schwindender Macht des zaristischen Russlands machte Litauen die ersten zögerlichen Schritte in die Unabhängigkeit. 1905/07 erhielt es teilweise Autonomie und forderte eine Verfassungsversammlung. Während des Ersten Weltkriegs wurde das Land von den Deutschen besetzt und rief nach dem Erfolg der Russischen Revolution 1918 eine demokratische Republik aus. Dies veranlasste die Russen, in Vilnius einzumarschieren, um den jungen Staat Russland wieder einzuverleiben, aber die Intervention deutscher und polnischer Truppen verhinderte Litauens Integrierung. Nichtsdestotrotz annektierte Polen Vilnius im Russisch-Polnischen Krieg 1920. Diese Annexion wurde 1922 von einem Referendum anerkannt. 1923 annektierte Litauen das Memelgebiet, welches bis 1919 unter preußischer Herrschaft und danach unter alliierter Verwaltung gestanden hatte. Die Konferenz der alliierten Botschafter erkannte die Annektierung an, bestand aber auf interner Autonomie für die Region. Die Zeit nach dem Großen Krieg war von internen Krisen in Litauen geprägt. 1922 entschied die Regierung über eine Landreform, während deren Verlauf sie den Großgrundbesitzern Land abnahm und sie ihrer politischen und wirtschaftlichen Führung beraubte. Soziale Spannungen wuchsen und führten 1926 zum Sturz der Regierung durch die Armee und die rechtsgerichtete Tautinenkae-Partei. Die republikanische Verfassung wurde gekippt und ein autoritäres Regime unter Antanas Smetona eingesetzt. 1934 wurde mit Lettland und Estland die Baltische Entente geformt.

English: A strategic fortress since the Roman era and an independent nation since the Middle Ages, the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg sat in the middle of the battleground between Germany and France in the Weitkrieg. The country was annexed into the Reich as a constituent nation following the Peace with Honour in 1921, with the Grand Duchy enlarged to include former Belgian Luxeburg. Following the dissolution of the German Empire in the aftermath of the Second Weitkrieg, Luxembourg regained its independence.
French: Le congrès de Vienne de 1814-1815 proclame l’intégration du Grand Duché du Luxembourg au royaume néerlandais. En tant que Grand Duc du Luxembourg, le roi hollandais fait également partie de la ligue germanique. Après l’indépendance de la Belgique, proclamée en 1831, le protocole de Londres de 1839 contraint le Luxembourg à céder ses territoires wallons à la Belgique. Les Hollandais tentent de vendre le Grand Duché à la France après la dissolution de la ligue germanique en 1866. Le Luxembourg entre dès lors dans une période de crise qui prend fin lorsque le pays devient définitivement neutre et indépendant. L’union avec les Pays-Bas se termine en 1890 à la mort de Guillaume III, le dernier héritier masculin de la dynastie Orange-Nassau. La loi salique du Luxembourg ne permet pas aux femmes de monter sur le trône. Pendant la Première Guerre mondiale, l’Allemagne ne se soucie pas de la neutralité du pays et décide d’occuper le Grand Duché.
Italian: Il congresso di Vienna del 1814/15, aveva proclamato il Lussemburgo un Gran Ducato e lo aveva reso parte del Regno d'Olanda. Il re olandese era, in quanto allo stesso tempo Gran Duca di Lussemburgo, membro della lega tedesca. Dopo l'indipendenza del Belgio nel 1831, il Lussemburgo fu costretto dal protocollo di Londra (1939), a restituire i suoi territori valloni al Belgio. I tentativi degli olandesi di vendere il Gran Ducato alla Francia dopo la fine della lega tedesca nel 1866, causarono la crisi del Lussemburgo che terminò con la dichiarazione formale di indipendenza e neutralità per il piccolo paese. Con la morte dell'ultimo erede maschio della casa Orange-Nassau, Wilhelm III (1890), fu sancita la fine dell'unione con l'Olanda. La legge Salian del Lussemburgo non permetteva infatti agli eredi femmine di succedere alla corona. Durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale, la Germania non rispettò la neutralità del paese, occupando il Gran Ducato.
Spanish: El Congreso de Viena de 1814-15 proclamó Gran Ducado a Luxemburgo y lo convirtió en parte del reino de Holanda. El rey holandés, como gran duque de Luxemburgo, era al mismo tiempo parte de la Confederación Alemana. Tras la independencia de Bélgica en 1831, se le obligó a entregarle a ésta sus territorios valones por orden del Protocolo de Londres de 1839. Los intentos holandeses de vender el gran ducado a los franceses tras la extinción de la Confederación Alemana en 1866 causaron la Crisis de Luxemburgo, que acabó con la concesión oficial de independencia y neutralidad al pequeño país. La unión personal con Holanda llegó a su fin en 1890, con la muerte de Guillermo III, último heredero varón de la casa de Orange-Nassau. La Ley Sálica que regía en Luxemburgo no permitía el acceso de mujeres al trono. Durante la Primera Guerra Mundial, Alemania no respetó la neutralidad del país y ocupó el gran ducado.
German: Der Wiener Kongress von 1814/15 erklärte Luxemburg zu einem Großherzogtum und gliederte es in das Niederländischen Königreich ein. Der holländische König war als Großherzog von Luxemburg zur gleichen Zeit ein Mitglied des Deutschen Bundes. Nach der Ausrufung der belgischen Unabhängigkeit 1831 musste Holland gemäß dem Londoner Protokoll von 1839 sein wallonisches Gebiet an Belgien abtreten. Die holländischen Versuche, das Großherzogtum nach Auflösung des Deutschen Bundes 1866 an die Franzosen zu verkaufen, erzeugte die Luxemburger Krise, die damit endete, dass dem kleinen Land formal die Unabhängigkeit und Neutralität zugesprochen wurde. Die Personalunion mit den Niederlanden endete 1890 mit dem Tod Wilhelms III., des letzten männlichen Thronfolgers des Hauses Oranien-Nassau, und das Salische Recht Luxemburgs erlaubte keine weiblichen Thronfolger. Während des ersten Weltkrieges missachtete Deutschland die Neutralität des Landes und besetzte das Großherzogtum.

Holenderski król i równoczeœnie Wielki Ksi¹¿ê Luksemburga wprowadzi³ swój kraj do Ligi Niemieckiej. English: When Italy surrendered to the Central Powers in 1919, the Ottomans regained Libya as part of their Empire. However, despite the final victory in the war, the Weltkrieg showed the weakness and the decline of the Ottoman Empire. During the 1920s, with the decline of the Ottoman authority over the Empire and mounting internal pressure, Libya and Armenia were able to gain the position of autonomous region on June 1928. Since then, Libya remained loyal to its master in Constantinople, but lately the Arab population is again starting to show signs of distress and Egypt in the east might be waiting for the right occasion to free Libya from Ottoman rule... or to become its new master!

After the Fengtian Clique's disastrous defeat of 1922 against the Whili Clique, Zhang Zuolin, warloard of Manchuria, had reorganized the Fengtian Army,started a training program and had bought new equipment like mobile radios and machine guns.Meanwhile, the germans defeated the Japanese in the newly acquired German Indochina, and later agreed to a white peace, since Japan was only  in the war to grab some pacific islands. In the autumn of 1924 fighting broke out against the German intervention in South and Central China,and landings took place on the coast of Zhili and Tianjin as the Germans were eager to capture Beijing. Fearing that the germans would soon turn on his Warlord state, Zhang Zuolin made a pact with the japanese that left Manchuria as a subordinate ally of Japan, giving japanese companies special priveliges that caused much bitterness among Manchurian businessmen. A later agreement upon the foundation of the Qing Empire between between Japan and Germany was to leave Manchuria as a de jure autonomous part of the new Qing empire, under "japanese protection". This left the Fengtian Clique in peace, with Japan no longer an enemy, and the threat of German invasion gone. Industry continued to grow,suffereing a slight setback upon the death of Fengtian's loyal civil governor Wang Yongjiang, when he died from kidney failure on the 1st of November 1927.Now, nine years later, Zhang Zuolin with his junta of warlords and republican refugees, have created a strong power base in Manchuria.With german influence in China weakening, many opportunites lay open to the old general. Should the alliance with Japan be strengthened, and the weak Qing Empire be overthrown? Should Manchuria be the Qing's sword, liberating China from the foreign devils ? Or will Zhang rise over all foes and rivals, to become surpreme ruler of all China, founding a new dynasty ? Only time will tell.

By 1936, Mexico has nationalized many of the foreign and private companies operating within their borders except the oil industry. Mexico, for the first time in its history is prospering although 'Hero of the Revolution' and President of Mexico Emiliano Zapata has fallen ill. The future of Mexico is unpredictable, as Zapata's first choice for President and Chairman of the Socialist Party, Vicente Lombardo, has enemies from all sides and Marshall Arango is only the first among many who could seize power. Other leaders in the military, perhaps not strong enough individually, are in opposition to both Arango and Zapata. In addition, Mexico also has the world's most unstable great power on its northern border, and the situation in Central America is becoming increasingly tense. These problems will not stop Zapata or his successor from trying to accomplish the goals he left behind, making a strong, independent and stable Mexico.
French: Après des décennies marquées par les révolutions, les rébellions et les coups d’Etat répétés contre les gouvernements corrompus, le Mexique commence enfin à se reconstruire.  Sous la direction de Plutarco Elias Calles, le pays parvient finalement à se rallier sous un gouvernement stable mais corrompu aux mains du parti nationaliste révolutionnaire. Les présidents émanant du parti sont tous sous les ordres de Calles. En 1934, Calles, qui mène une politique de plus en plus conservatrice, est obligé de faire quelques concessions au profit des membres gauchistes du parti en acceptant de choisir Lázaro Cárdenas comme candidat à la présidentielle pour le PNR. Le choix se révèle effectivement fatidique. Cárdenas est un homme politique d’une honnêteté scrupuleuse qui refuse catégoriquement d’être la marionnette d’un autre politicien. Il entrera en conflit avec Calles sur de nombreux points. Au début de l’année 1936, la situation politique est de plus en plus explosive à cause des conflits entre l’ancien homme fort et son nouveau rival. Reste à savoir qui tirera le premier...
Italian: Tormentato da anni di rivoluzioni, ribellioni e ripetuti colpi di stato contro i governi corrotti, il Messico aveva finalmente imboccato la strada della ripresa. Infatti, sotto la guida di Plutarco Elías Calles, se non in nome della decade appena passata, il Messico aveva ottenuto un governo stabile ma corrotto sotto il partito nazionale rivoluzionario, i cui successivi presidenti erano quasi completamente sottomessi a Calles. Nel 1934, il sempre più conservatore Calles, fu costretto a fare delle concessioni ai membri dell'ala sinistra del suo partito, accettando di nominare Lázaro Cárdenas come candidato del partito nazionale rivoluzionario alla presidenza. Tale scelta si sarebbe rivelata decisiva, perché Cárdenas era un politico onesto e scrupoloso che non accettava di essere comandato e discusse con Calles su numerosi problemi. All'inizio del 1936, lo scenario politico stava diventando sempre più volubile, dominato dallo scontro fra l'ex uomo forte e il suo nuovo rivale al potere. L'unico problema era vedere chi avrebbe fatto la prima mossa...
Spanish: Arruinado por años de revoluciones, rebeliones y repetidos golpes de estado contra gobiernos corruptos, México se encontraba por fin camino de la recuperación. Bajo el control, real pero no nominal, de Plutarco Elías Calles durante las últimas décadas, México había logrado tener un gobierno estable pero corrupto con el Partido Nacional Revolucionario, cuyos sucesivos presidentes estaban bajo el control casi absoluto de Calles. En 1934, el cada vez más conservador Calles se vio obligado a hacer concesiones a miembros del ala izquierda de su partido, aceptando la nominación de Lázaro Cárdenas como candidato presidencial del PNR. Iba a resultar una elección fatídica, pues Cárdenas era un político escrupulosamente honesto que se negaba a ser controlado y discutió con Calles sobre numerosos temas. A comienzos de 1936, el ambiente político entre el antiguo hombre fuerte y su nuevo rival por el poder se volvía cada vez más volátil. Lo único que quedaba por ver era quién haría el primer movimiento...
German: Nachdem es Jahre der Revolution, Rebellion und wiederholter Staatsstreiche gegen korrupte Regierungen überstanden hatte, befand sich Mexiko endlich wieder auf dem Weg der Besserung. Im vergangenen Jahrzehnt war Mexiko von einer sowohl stabilen als auch korrupten Regierung der Nationalen Revolutionspartei (NRP) geleitet worden, deren aufeinanderfolgende Präsidenten fast vollständig unter dem Einfluss von Plutarco Elías Calles standen. 1934 sah sich der zunehmend konservativ eingestellte Calles gezwungen, der Linken seiner Partei Zugeständnisse zu machen, weshalb er der Nominierung von Lázaro Cárdenas als Präsidentschaftskandidat der NRP zustimmte. Dies sollte sich als schicksalhafte Wahl herausstellen: Cárdenas war ehrlich bis aufs Mark, wehrte sich gegen jede Fremdkontrolle und stritt mit Calles wegen zahlreicher Angelegenheiten. Zu Beginn des Jahres 1936 begann die politische Luft zwischen dem ehemaligen starken Mann Mexikos und seinem neuen Rivalen um die Macht zunehmend dünner zu werden. Die einzige Frage war nun, wer den ersten Schritt machen würde......

English: Once the greatest empire in the world, the land of Genghis Khan has long had to struggle for it's independence. Though freed from Chinese rule following the collapse of the ruling Manchu dynasty in 1911, Mongolia's independence was not recognized by the new Republic of China, and therefore Mongolia increasingly turned to Russia for it's continued survival. Yet, the unexpected Russian Revolution of 1917 placed Mongolia in a vulnerable position, with the Russian Civil War soon spilling over the border into it's protectorate. After suffering from an invasion by a Chinese warlord army, a counter-invasion White Russian forces under Baron Roman Nicolaus von Ungern-Sternberg, who established himself as rule of Mongolia. Eager to maintain the security of their southern flank, the remaining White Generals recognized von Ungern-Sternberg's government, believing that he would pursue a pro-Russian foreign policy. However, the Baron had other ideas. While Civil War raged within European Russia, Mongolian forces with Japanese diplomatic support seized and announced their sovereignty over a significant section of the Transiberian Railroad. Kerensky had no choice but to accept this, to avoid the complete strangulation and isolation of Russian troops in Europe and the Far-East. Sternberg then set to work promoting his political authority in Mongolia, and developing a powerful military apparatus. He is now too powerful for a weak Russian government to dislodge, and any crisis in Russia or China may inspire him to make his claims to be Khan of All Mongols a reality...
French: Coincé entre les empires gigantesques de la Russie et de la Chine, le pays de Gengis Khan doit constamment défendre son indépendance. Bien que le pays soit libéré de l’emprise chinoise depuis la chute de la dynastie mandchoue en 1911, l’indépendance de la Mongolie n’est pas officiellement reconnue par la Chine. C’est pour cette raison que le pays se tourne plutôt vers la Russie pour assurer sa survie. Or, l’éclatement inattendu de la révolution russe en 1917 place la Mongolie dans une position extrêmement vulnérable qui sera rapidement aggravée par le débordement de la guerre civile russe en dehors de ses frontières. La Mongolie entre alors dans une période extrêmement trouble durant laquelle elle subit l’invasion d’une armée seigneuriale chinoise, la contre invasion des forces biélorusses sous la direction du baron Roman Nicolaus von Ungern-Sternberg, l’insurrection de l’Armée Partisane de Suhe Bator et, finalement, un coup d’Etat qui achève de détruire la vieille monarchie. Ces évènements transforment rapidement la Mongolie en deuxième état communiste du monde, allié unique de l’URSS qui exerce sur le pays un pouvoir considérable. La situation nationale finit par se stabiliser en 1924, mais l’histoire de la Mongolie continuera à refléter les tragédies vécues par l’URSS. Dans les années 1920, l’Etat mongole procède à une élimination des sujets capitalistes, bannit la religion et les moines bouddhistes et supprime le système féodal. Mais le rythme dévastateur de la révolution socialiste est interrompu par la menace, en 1936, des ambitions expansionnistes du Japon. La Mongolie doit maintenant se préparer à contrer une éventuelle attaque de l’ogre japonais.
Italian: Incastrata fra i giganteschi imperi di Russia e Cina, la terra di Genghis Khan dovette lottare parecchio per raggiungere la propria indipendenza. Liberatasi dal governo cinese nel 1911, in seguito al crollo della dinastia regnante Manciù, l'indipendenza della Mongolia non venne riconosciuta dalla nuova Repubblica cinese, costringendo il paese a rivolgersi sempre più alla Russia per sopravvivere, fino a quando, l'inattesa rivoluzione russa del 1917, mise la Mongolia in una posizione vulnerabile, con la guerra civile russa che presto si sarebbe allargata oltre i confini fino al protettorato mongolo. Dopo aver sofferto un'invasione da parte di un esercito di un grande capo cinese, una contro-invasione delle forze bianche russe sotto il barone Roman Nicolaus von Ungern-Sternberg, una rivolta dell'esercito partigiano mongolo di Sukhe Bator, e infine un colpo di stato che rovesciò completamente la vecchia monarchia, la Mongolia emerse come il secondo stato comunista al mondo e l'unico alleato dell'Unione Sovietica, anche se sotto lo stretto controllo di quest'ultima. Nonostante avesse raggiunto la stabilità nel 1924, la storia della Mongolia avrebbe d'ora in avanti riflettuto tutte le tragedie che hanno consumato il loro più grande vicino a nord. Durante gli anni '20, furono condotte epurazioni per ripulire il paese dagli elementi 'capitalisti'. Monaci e religiosi buddisti vennero attivamente soppressi e il potere dei vecchi signori feudali fu definitivamente annientato. Nel 1936, tuttavia, la rivoluzione socialista venne rovesciata dinanzi al nuovo pericolo portato dal Giappone espansionista. Il compito, a questo punto consisteva nel prepararsi militarmente a fronteggiare un eventuale attacco giapponese.
Spanish: Atrapada entre los gigantescos imperios de Rusia y China, la tierra de Gengis Khan lleva mucho tiempo luchando por su independencia. Aunque libre del yugo chino desde el hundimiento de la dinastía manchú en 1911, la independencia de Mongolia no fue reconocida por la nueva República China, así que Mongolia acudió cada vez más a Rusia para asegurar su supervivencia. Pero la inesperada Revolución Rusa de 1917 dejó a Mongolia en una posición vulnerable, con la guerra civil que pronto rebasó la frontera y alcanzó a su protectorado. Tras sufrir la invasión del ejército de un señor de la guerra chino, una contrainvasión por parte de las fuerzas contrarrevolucionarias al mando del barón Roman Nicolaus von Ungern-Sternberg, una revuelta por parte del Ejército Partisano Mongol de Sujé Bator y, por último, un golpe de estado que derrocó de manera total a la antigua monarquía, Mongolia emergió como el segundo estado comunista del mundo y como el único aliado de la Unión Soviética, aunque controlado estrechamente por ella. Aunque por fin se estabilizó en 1924, la historia futura de Mongolia iba a reflejar todas las tragedias que consumieron a su vecino del norte, más poderoso. A lo largo de los años 20 se llevaron a cabo purgas para librar al país de elementos 'capitalistas'. Los monjes budistas y la religión fueron activamente reprimidos y el poder de los antiguos señores feudales fue aniquilado. Sin embargo, para 1936, la revolución socialista se difumina ante una nueva amenaza del expansionismo nipón. La tarea ahora es prepararse militarmente para el día, si es que llega, en que Japón decida añadir Mongolia a su imperio en expansión.
German: Eingekeilt zwischen den mächtigen Reichen Russland und China musste Dschingis Khans Land lange für seine Unabhängigkeit kämpfen. Obwohl es nach dem Zusammenbruch der mandschurischen Dynastie 1911 von der chinesischen Herrschaft befreit worden war, erkannte die neue chinesische Republik die Unabhängigkeit der Mongolei nicht an, die sich daraufhin in ihren Bemühungen um das eigene Fortbestehen an Russland wandte. Durch die unerwartete russische Revolution im Jahr 1917 geriet die Mongolei jedoch in eine gefährliche Situation, als sich der russische Bürgerkrieg über die russischen Grenzen bis in das mongolische Protektorat ausweitete. Nachdem das Land die Invasion der Armee eines chinesischen Kriegsherren, eine Gegeninvasion der Weißrussen unter Baron Roman Nikolaus von Ungern-Sternberg, einen Aufstand der mongolischen Partisanenarmee von Sukhe Bator und letztendlich einen Staatsstreich erduldet hatte, der die alte Monarchie vollständig beseitigte, wurde es zum weltweit zweiten kommunistischen Staat und dem einzigen Verbündeten der Sowjetunion (obgleich unter starker sowjetischer Kontrolle). Obwohl die Lage in der Mongolei 1924 endlich stabil geworden war, wurde es fortan von den gleichen Tragödien wie sein nördlicher Nachbar heimgesucht: Während der 1920iger Jahren wurden Säuberungsaktionen durchgeführt, um das Land von “kapitalistischen Elementen” zu befreien. Die buddhistische Religion und ihre Mönche wurden aktiv unterdrückt und das Feudalsystem zerschlagen.1936 wurde die sozialistische Revolution jedoch angesichts der neuerlichen Bedrohung durch das expansionistische Japan zurückgestellt. Nun ist es an der Zeit, sich militärisch für den Fall vorzubereiten, dass sich Japan entschließt, die Mongolei seinem wachsenden Reich hinzuzufügen.

English: After the violent withdrawal of British presence in India after the British Revolution, Nepal found itself in an unstable situation. The Rana family, which had dominated Nepalese politics for generations, found itself coming under fire. Without the British support they depended on, Prime Minister Chandra Shamsher was increasingly unable to assert his will over the teenage king Tribhuvana. At the same time, the young King of Nepal realized that now was the time to free himself from his childhood imprisonment and blackmail. So with the support of the Nepali Sena (Nepalese Army) – who had always supported the Shah Dynasty over the Ranas – several brigades of Gurkhas stormed the Narayanhiti Palace in central Kathmandu, capturing or killing all of the Rana family. At the same time, raids in the early morning by the Nepali Sena all throughout the Kathmandu Valley and in Patan and Bhaktapur captured most of the fringes of the Rana family, who still retained loyalty to Chandra. In a swift move, one of his first as Absolute Monarch, King Tribhuvana ordered the execution of all the senior Rana family, Chandra included. The resulting chaos could have torn Nepal apart, but the military held it together, barely. Not long after the executions, the Nepali Sena expanded outward into the vacuum of India, occupying most of the Ganges-Yamuna basin. In 1936, the cabinet of Nepal is divided between Tribhuvana and his family, as well as disillusioned British politicians who have lost all faith in there homeland. In addition, overtures for alliance with the kingdoms of Bhutan and Sikkim have elevated Nepal to a sizeable power in post-British India.

Formed in 1931 as a response to growing extremist influences, the United Provinces of Central America is a union between the republics of Nicaragua and Costa Rica formed to protect their relatively democratic stable regimes. The young state's industry is split between US-controlled banana production and German dominated coffee production. In 1934 the state entered an alliance with Panama, mostly because United States wanted to cut direct involvement in the area and it was a means of making sure the preservation of the UP was an, albeit indirect, US interest.Even if the state is split between American and German backed interest groups, the social problems of United Provinces pale in comparison with the socialist revolts and skirmishes the north has experienced. Now US influence is waning many feel it is time for United Provinces to decide whether it is content with the inevitable eventual domination of the domestic situation by Germany, or whether it should start to push for ‘a way of it's own’.
French: Le président libéral du Nicaragua, José Santos Zalaya (1894-1909) entreprend dès son élection de moderniser le pays. Ses projets sont néanmoins brutalement interrompus en 1909 lorsque ses opposants lancent contre lui un coup d’Etat. Ils sont soutenus par les Etats-Unis qui portent un intérêt tout particulier au canal de Panama menacé, selon eux, par la politique expansionniste de Zalaya. Les Etats-Unis interviennent également dans le conflit opposant conservateurs et libéraux. Les Américains assurent jusqu’en 1933 le contrôle militaire, économique et politique du pays, grâce à des troupes réparties sur l’ensemble du territoire nicaraguayen jusqu’en 1932. La résistance dirigée par Augosto César Sandino parvient à évacuer les troupes américaines en 1932/33. Le pays continue toutefois à subir leur influence indirecte sous le gouvernement de Anastasio “Tacho” Somoza Garcia, un protégé de Washington qui accède au pouvoir après avoir assassiné Sandino en 1934.
Italian: Il presidente liberale José Santos Zalaya (1894-1909), che aveva intrapreso un percorso di modernizzazione per il Nicaragua, fu rovesciato con l'aiuto degli Stati Uniti, i cui interessi sul canale di Panama erano minacciati dalla politica espansionistica di Zalaya. Gli Stati Uniti intervennero direttamente anche nel 1912, nel conflitto fra liberali e conservatori. Fino al 1933, gli americani conservarono il controllo militare, economico e politico del paese, con la presenza delle proprie truppe dal 1932. La resistenza, guidata da Augusto César Sandino, ottenne la ritirata degli Stati Uniti nel 1932/33, anche se il paese rimase sotto l'influenza indiretta americana. Anastasio 'Tacho' Somoza García, salito al potere dopo la ritirata americana, era un protetto d Washington e assassinò Sandino nel 1934.
Spanish: El presidente liberal José Santos Zalaya (1894-1909), que había llevado a cabo una política de modernización en Nicaragua, fue derrocado con la ayuda de los Estados Unidos, que vieron la política expansionista de Zalaya como una amenaza a sus intereses en el Canal de Panamá. En 1912, los Estados Unidos también intervinieron de manera directa en el conflicto entre liberales y conservadores. Hasta 1933, los Estados Unidos controlaban el país militar, política y económicamente, con tropas estacionadas allí hasta 1932. La resistencia, liderada por Augusto César Sandino, logró la retirada de los Estados Unidos en 1932-33, pero éstos mantuvieron su influencia indirecta en el país. Anastasio 'Tacho' Somoza García, que llegó al poder tras la salida de los estadounidenses, era un protegido de Washington que hizo asesinar a Sandino en 1934.
German: Der liberale Präsident Nicaraguas, José Santos Zalaya (1894 - 1909), welcher einen Modernisierungskurs verfolgt hatte, wurde mit Hilfe der USA gestürzt, die ihr Interesse am Panamakanal durch die Expansionspolitik Zalayas gefährdet sahen. 1912 waren es ebenfalls die Amerikaner, die direkt in einen Konflikt zwischen Konservativen und Liberalen eingriffen. Bis 1933 behielt die USA die militärische, wirtschaftliche und politische Kontrolle über das Land, in dem sie bis 1932 Truppen stationiert hatten. Doch obwohl die von Augusto César Sandino geführte Widerstandsbewegung 1932/33 den Abzug der USA erreichten, blieb das Land weiter unter dem indirekten Einfluss der Amerikaner: Anastasio 'Tacho' Somoza García, der nach dem Abzug der USA an die Macht kam, war ein Schützling Washingtons und ließ Sandino 1934 ermorden.

English: For centuries Norway had been part of the Danish realm until Denmark had to cede - without Iceland or Greenland - it to Sweden in the Peace of Kiel. An attempt of the Norwegians to proclaim independence from their Swedish neighbour was foiled by a military intervention by King Karl XIII. However, the Swedish king allowed his new subjects internal autonomy by recognizing their constitution. Tensions between the parliament (Storting) and the king in Sweden escalated in the 1870. Under leadership of the liberal left (Venstre) the country turned into parliamentary monarchy in 1884 with universal suffrage after 1898 (till 1913 only for men). With Norway's rise as a trading power in the 19th century came claims to install consulates in other countries. Resistance by Sweden against this claim caused the end of the Union between the countries in 1905. The Danish prince Karl was elected King Haakon VII. Despite British demands Norway remained neutral during the Weltkrieg, even though it lost half its merchant marine to Germany's unrestricted U-Boat warfare. In 1920 Norway occupied Spitzbergen despite Russian claims to the islands. The transition of from an agricultural country to a modern industrial state brought with it inflation and unemployment after the Weltkrieg, leading to a radicalization of the Worker's Party which had been founded in 1887.
French: La Norvège appartient au royaume danois jusqu’à ce que le traité de Kiel l’oblige à la céder à la Suède. Les Norvégiens essaient en vain de se libérer du voisin suédois qui répond par une intervention militaire. Le roi suédois, Charles XIII, laisse toutefois à ces nouveaux sujets une autonomie interne en reconnaissant la constitution déjà existante. Les tensions opposant le parlement (Storting) au roi de Suède s’aggravent en 1870. La gauche libérale (venstre) transforme, en 1884, le pays en une monarchie parlementaire soumise au suffrage universel dès 1898 (réservé aux hommes jusqu’en 1913). Le développement économique et commercial du pays au cours du 19e siècle fait germer l’idée de créer des consulats à l’étranger. La résistance suédoise aux réclamations norvégiennes met fin à l’union en 1905. Le prince danois Charles est alors élu roi Haakon VII de Norvège. Malgré la sollicitation des Britanniques, la Norvège reste neutre pendant la Première Guerre mondiale, la moitié de sa marine marchande est cependant engloutie par la machine de guerre sous-marine des Allemands. En 1920, la Société des Nations attribue le Spitzberg à la Norvège contre l’avis des Russes qui estiment que l’archipel doit leur revenir. Son passage rapide d’un état agraire à une nation moderne et industrialisée ne va pas sans soulever des problèmes d’inflation et de chômage après la Grande Guerre. Le parti travailliste profite de la situation économique pour adopter des idées plus radicales. Le parti communiste norvégien est fondé en 1923 et le parti fasciste, en 1933, sous la direction de Vidkun Quisling.
Italian: Per diversi secoli, la Norvegia ha fatto parte del regno danese fino a quando la Danimarca ha dovuto cederla - senza l'Islanda o la Groenlandia - alla Svezia con la pace di Kiel. Un tentativo da parte dei norvegesi di proclamare la propria indipendenza dalla Svezia fu soffocato dall'intervento militare di re Karl XIII. Tuttavia, il re svedese concesse ai suoi nuovi sudditi un'autonomia interna riconoscendo la loro costituzione. Le tensioni fra il parlamento (Storting) e il re svedese, aumentarono nel 1870. Sotto la guida della sinistra liberale (Venstre), nel 1884 il paese divenne una monarchia parlamentare, con un suffragio universale dopo il 1898 (fino al 1913 solo per gli uomini). Con la crescita della Norvegia come potenza commerciale, nel diciannovesimo secolo arrivarono le richieste di stabilire consolati in altri paesi. La resistenza della Svezia contro questa richiesta, causò nel 1905 la fine dell'unione fra i due paesi. Il principe Karl di Danimarca diventa re col nome di Haakon VII. Nonostante le richieste inglesi, la Norvegia conservò la propria neutralità durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale, anche se perse metà della sua flotta mercantile nella guerra con i sommergibili tedeschi. Nel 1920, la lega delle nazioni assegnò le Spitzbergen alla Norvegia nonostante le mire russe su quelle isole. Il passaggio da paese agricolo a moderno stato industriale dopo la Grande Guerra, si trascinò con sé l'inflazione e la disoccupazione, portando a una radicalizzazione del partito operaio fondato nel 1887. Nel 1923, venne costituito il partito comunista e nel 1933 il partito fascista Nosjonal Samling sotto la guida di Vidkun Quisling.
Spanish: Durante siglos, Noruega había formado parte del reino danés, hasta que Dinamarca se vio obligada a cedérsela a Suecia, sin Islandia ni Groenlandia, en el Tratado de Kiel. Un intento por parte de los noruegos de proclamarse independientes de su vecino sueco fue desbaratado por una intervención militar ordenada por el rey Carlos XIII. Sin embargo, el rey sueco permitió a sus nuevos súbditos una autonomía interior con el reconocimiento de su constitución. Las tensiones entre el Parlamento (storting) y el rey de Suecia se intensificaron en la década de 1870. Bajo el liderazgo de la izquierda liberal (venstre), en 1884, el país se convirtió en una monarquía parlamentaria con sufragio universal después de 1898 (sólo para los hombres hasta 1913). Con el ascenso de Noruega como una potencia comercial en el siglo XIX, llegaron las peticiones de establecer consulados en otros países. La resistencia de Suecia a esta petición causó el final de la Unión entre ambos países en 1905. El príncipe danés Carlos fue elegido rey con el nombre de Haakon VII. Pese a las peticiones británicas, Noruega permaneció neutral durante la Primera Guerra Mundial, a pesar de que perdió la mitad de su marina mercante a manos de la indiscriminada guerra submarina de Alemania. En 1920, la Sociedad de Naciones otorgó el archipiélago de Svarbald a Noruega a pesar de ser reivindicado por Rusia. La transición desde un país agrícola a un estado industrial moderno trajo consigo la inflación y el desempleo tras la Gran Guerra, lo que llevó a una radicalización del Partido de los Trabajadores, fundado en 1887. En 1923 se formó un Partido Comunista y en 1933 apareció un partido fascista, el Nosjonal Samling (Unión Nacional), bajo el liderazgo de Vidkun Quisling.
German: Jahrhundertelang war Norwegen Teil des Dänischen Reiches gewesen, bis Dänenmark es – ohne Island oder Grönland – im Frieden von Kiel an Schweden abtreten musste. Ein Versuch der Norweger, Unabhängigkeit von ihren schwedischen Nachbarn zu erlangen, wurde durch eine Militäraktion König Karls XIII. vereitelt. Trotzdem erlaubte der schwedische König seinen neuen Untertanen interne Autonomie durch Anerkennung ihrer Verfassung. Spannungen zwischen Parlament (Storting) und dem König in Schweden eskalierten 1870. Unter der Führung der liberalen Linken (Venstre) wurde das Land 1884 zu einer parlamentarischen Monarchie mit universellem Wahlrecht nach 1898 (bis 1913 nur für Männer). Mit Norwegens Aufstieg als eine Handelsmacht im 19. Jahrhundert kamen Forderungen, Konsulate in anderen Ländern einzurichten. Schwedens Widerstand gegen diesen Anspruch führte 1905 zum Ende der Union zwischen den Ländern. Der dänische Prinz Karl wurde zum König Haakon VII. gewählt. Trotz britischer Forderungen blieb Norwegen während des Ersten Weltkriegs neutral, obwohl es die Hälfte seiner Handelsmarine an Deutschlands uneingeschränkten U-Bootkrieg verlor. 1920 gab der Völkerbund Spitzbergen trotz russischer Ansprüche auf die Inseln an Norwegen. Der Übergang von einem Agrarland zu einem modernen Industriestaat brachte nach dem Großen Krieg Inflation und Arbeitslosigkeit mit sich, was zu einer Radikalisierung der 1887 geführten Arbeiterpartei führte. 1923 wurde eine kommunistische Partie gegründet, und 1933 erschien die faschistische Partei Nosjonal Samling unter der Führung von Vidkun Quisling.
