English: New Zealand was granted its dominion status in 1907, and since then has remained linked closely both with it's mother country Britain and it's larger neighbor Australia. In fact, New Zealand's experiences mirrored those of Australia in many ways, New Zealanders served in the ANZAC (Australian and New Zealand Army Corps), and fought with great distinction from Flanders to Gallipoli to Egypt and Turkey. As a result, they took disproportionate casualties for such a small nation, with over 18,000 of an original overseas force of 100,000 killed in action. Nevertheless, they earned a reputation for ferocity in battle which has never faded. By the 1930's, the Great Depression hit New Zealand's economy hard, with export prices plummeting and lay-offs souring. By 1935, despite the best efforts of the National Party to remedy the situation, New Zealand's economy was in shambles and the Labor party was brought to power as a result. New Zealand is by no means ready for war in 1936, but if it comes, like her larger neighbor, her soldiers can be counted on to support Britain.
French: La Nouvelle-Zélande devient un dominion britannique quasi indépendant en 1907, continuant à entretenir des relations très étroites avec l’ancien colonisateur britannique et le voisin australien. L’histoire néo-zélandaise concorde en de nombreux points avec l’histoire australienne, les néo-zélandais rejoignent l’ANZAC, une armée au sein de laquelle ils se battent courageusement des Flandres à Gallipoli en passant par l’Egypte et la Turquie. Les pertes humaines sont considérables eu égard à la taille et à la population du pays, on compte plus de 18000 morts pour une armée de 100000 soldats. Depuis ce temps, ils bénéficient pourtant d’une réputation inébranlable de combattants féroces. Dans les années 1930, l’économie néo-zélandaise est heurtée de plein fouet par la Grande Dépression qui fait dégringoler les prix à l’exportation et multiplie le nombre de licenciements. Malgré le travail acharné du parti national pour renverser la situation dans laquelle se trouve le pays, l’économie néo-zélandaise reste catastrophique et conduit la population à élire le parti travailliste dès 1935. La Nouvelle-Zélande est loin d’être préparée à la guerre en 1936, mais en admettant qu’elle éclate, ses soldats n’hésiteront pas à soutenir les Britanniques aux côtés de leurs voisins australiens.
Italian: La Nuova Zelanda ottenne il suo stato di sovranità nel 1907 e da allora è rimasta legata strettamente sia alla madre patria inglese, sia alla vicina Australia. In effetti, le esperienze della Nuova Zelanda rispecchiano sotto molti aspetti quelle australiane. I neozelandesi presero parte all'ANZAC (il corpo d'armata australiano e neozelandese) e si batterono con grande merito dalle Fiandre a Gallipoli fino all'Egitto e alla Turchia. Come risultato essi hanno sofferto un numero di vittime sproporzionato per una nazione così piccola, con oltre 18.000 uomini uccisi in azione dei 100.000 componenti la forza originale. Nonostante questo essi si sono guadagnati una reputazione per la loro ferocia in battaglia che non è stata ancora dissolta. Negli anni '30, l'economia della Nuova Zelanda fu messa a dura prova dalla grande depressione, con conseguente crollo dei prezzi delle esportazioni e numerosi licenziamenti. Nel 1935, nonostante tutti gli sforzi fatti dal partito nazionale per rimediare alla situazione, l'economia della Nuova Zelanda era nel caos, situazione questa che favorì l'elezione al potere del partito laburista. Nel 1936, la Nuova Zelanda non era pronta per un'altra guerra, ma all'occorrenza, avrebbe comunque fornito il suo contributo di truppe all'Inghilterra, così come avrebbero fatto i vicini australiani.
Spanish: A Nueva Zelanda se le concedió su condición de dominio en 1907 y, desde entones, ha mantenido estrechos lazos tanto con su madre patria, Inglaterra, como con su vecino de mayor envergadura, Australia. De hecho, las experiencias de Nueva Zelanda fueron similares en muchos aspectos a las de Australia: los neozelandeses sirvieron en las divisiones Anzac (unidades militares de Australia y Nueva Zelanda) y lucharon con gran distinción desde Flandes a Gallípoli y desde Egipto a Turquía. De resultas de ello, los neozelandeses sufrieron un número de bajas fuera de toda proporción para un país tan modesto: 18.000 de las 100.000 bajas entre las fuerzas extranjeras en combate. No obstante, se ganaron una reputación por su ferocidad en el campo de batalla que ha seguido indeleble con el paso del tiempo. A la llegada de los años 30, la Gran Depresión golpeó con dureza a la economía neozelandesa, con un gran desplome de los precios y un gran aumento del número de despidos. Para 1935, pese a los grandes esfuerzos del Partido Nacional por poner remedio a la situación, la economía de Nueva Zelanda era desastrosa y, como consecuencia de ello, el Partido Laborista alcanzó el poder. En 1936, Nueva Zelanda no está, ni mucho menos, preparada para la guerra, pero, al igual que su vecino más grande, se puede contar con sus soldados para apoyar a Gran Bretaña.
German: Neuseeland wurde 1907 der Status eines Dominion gewährt. Seitdem ist es sowohl mit seinem Mutterland England als auch mit seinem größeren Nachbarn Australien eng verbunden. Tatsächlich ähneln die Erfahrungen Neuseelands denen Australiens in vielerlei Hinsicht: Neuseeländer dienten im ANZAC (Australian and New Zealand Army Corps) und kämpften mit Bravour in Flandern, in Gallipoli, in Ägypten und in der Türkei. Als Konsequenz daraus erlitt Neuseeland für ein Land seiner Größe unverhältnismäßig hohe Verluste. Von ursprünglich 100.000 Soldaten des Expeditionskorps waren 18.000 gefallen. Dennoch errangen sich die Neuseeländer den Ruf, im Kampf besonders wild zu sein – ein Ruf, der sich seit damals nichts geändert hat. In den 30er Jahren des 20. Jahrhunderts wurde Neuseelands Wirtschaft von der Großen Depression hart getroffen – die Exportpreise stürzten ab und viele Menschen verloren ihre Arbeit. 1935 lag Neuseelands Wirtschaft trotz der verzweifelten Anstrengungen der National Party in Trümmern, was zu einem Machtwechsel zugunsten der Labor Party führte. 1936 ist Neuseeland in keinster Weise kriegsbereit, aber im Notfall kann sich England auf die neuseeländische und australischen Truppen verlassen.

English: When Ahmad Al Bu Sa'id rose to power in 1749, Oman began an age of expansion. For about a hundred years Great Britain tolerated their sea trading empire which reached from the coasts of East Africa as far as China. Slave trading and the export of spices were the primary sources of income. Between 1789 and 1805 rivalries for the throne between factions within the Al Sa'id Dynasty preluded Oman's deminse. More and more it came under the influence of the British Empire without ever becoming a formal colony. During this feud, Muscat on the sea formed a sultanate while the inner country became a relgiously oriented imamate. The growing dominance of the British increased the political and economic dependency of Oman. Not only had they lost the rich island of Sansibar to the British, in exchange for which they recieved the Sansibar Subsidy, but the opening of the Suez Canal and the prohibition of slave and weapons trade had completely crippled their economy. This changed after the Weltkrieg and the 1925 British Revolution. Oman became free from British influence and was even able to annex the so-called "Trucial States", previously under British protection.
French: Lorsque Ahmad Al Bu Saïd prend le pouvoir en 1749, l’Oman commence se développer. La Grande-Bretagne a toléré pendant près d’un siècle le commerce maritime de cet empire qui s’étend des côtes d’Afrique orientale à la Chine. Le commerce des esclaves et l’exportation d’épices sont ses principales ressources. Entre 1789 et 1805, différentes factions de la dynastie Al Saïd se disputent le trône et annoncent déjà l’effondrement de l’Etat d’Oman. Le pays subit de plus en plus l’influence britannique sans pour autant avoir le statut officiel de colonie. Au cours de ces querelles, la région côtière de Muscat devient un sultanat tandis que l’intérieur du pays forme progressivement un imamat religieux. La mainmise britannique se fait de plus en plus pesante, augmentant de ce fait la dépendance économique et politique d’Oman. Le pays n’a pas seulement perdu la précieuse île de Zanzibar au profit des Britanniques, mais l’ouverture du canal de Suez ainsi que la restriction du commerce d’esclaves et d’armes ont véritablement paralysé l’économie nationale.
Italian: Con l'ascesa al potere di Ahmad Al Bu Sa'id nel 1749, per l'Oman iniziava un periodo di espansione. Per circa un centinaio d'anni, l'Inghilterra sopportò il loro impero commerciale marittimo, che arrivava dalle coste dell'Africa orientale fino in Cina. Il commercio degli schiavi e l'esportazione delle spezie erano le principali risorse di guadagno. Fra il 1789 e il 1805, le rivalità per il trono all'interno della dinastia Al Sa'id prelude alla fine dell'Oman. In più, esso passò sotto l'influenza dell'impero inglese senza mai diventare una colonia a tutti gli effetti. Durante questo feudo, Muscat fondò un sultanato sul mare, mentre il paese interno diventava un mandato a orientamento religioso. Il crescente dominio dell'Inghilterra aumentò la dipendenza politica ed economica dell'Oman. Non solo persero la ricca isola di Zanzibar in favore degli inglesi, in cambio della quale ricevettero un sussidio, ma l'apertura del canale di Suez e l'abolizione della schiavitù e del commercio delle armi bloccarono completamente bloccato la loro economia.
Spanish: Con la llegada de Ahmed ben Said al poder en 1749, Omán dio comienzo a una era de expansión. Durante unos cien años, Gran Bretaña había tolerado su imperio de comercio naval, que iba desde las costas del este de África hasta China. Las principales fuentes de ingresos eran el tráfico de esclavos y la exportación de especias. Entre 1789 y 1805, las rivalidades por el trono entre facciones de la dinastía Said fueron el preludio de la desaparición de Omán. Cayó más y más bajo la influencia del Imperio Británico, sin llegar a ser nunca una colonia oficial. Durante estos enfrentamientos, Mascate, en la costa, formó un sultanato, mientras que el interior del país se convirtió en un imanato con una fuerte orientación religiosa. La creciente dominación británica aumentó la dependencia económica y política de Omán. No sólo habían perdido la rica isla de Zanzíbar, que había pasado a manos británicas y a cambio de la cual recibieron el Subsidio de Zanzíbar, sino que la apertura del Canal de Suez y la prohibición del tráfico de esclavos y armas habían herido de muerte su economía.
German: Als Ahmad Al Bu Sa'id 1749 an die Macht kam, begann in Oman ein Zeitalter der Expansion: Großbritannien tolerierte sein Seehandelsreich, das sich von den Küsten Ostafrikas bis nach China erstreckte, etwa ein Jahrhundert lang. Die Haupteinnahmequellen Omans waren der Sklavenhandel und der Gewürzexport. Zwischen 1789 und 1805 leiteten Rivalitäten zwischen verschiedenen Gruppierungen innerhalb der Al Sa'id-Dynastie um den Thron den Niedergang Omans ein, das mehr und mehr unter den Einfluss des britischen Imperiums geriet, ohne jemals formell zur Kolonie zu werden. Während dieser Zwistigkeiten formte Muskat an der See ein Sultanat, während das Inland zu einem religiös ausgerichteten Imamat wurde. Durch die steigende Dominanz der Briten vergrößerte sich die politische und wirtschaftliche Abhängigkeit Omans. Man verlor nicht nur die reiche Insel Sansibar an die Briten, wofür diese als Ausgleich die Sansibar-Zuschüsse (Sansibar Subsidy) zahlten, sondern erlitt auch durch die Öffnung des Suez-Kanals und den Verbot des Sklaven- und Waffenhandels verheerende Wirtschaftseinbußen.

Przez oko³o sto lat Wielka Brytania tolerowa³a potêgê imperium rozci¹gaj¹cego siê od wschodnich wybrze¿y Afryki, a¿ do granic Chin. G³ównymi Ÿród³ami ekonomicznej potêgi Omanu by³ morski handel cennymi towarami: niewolnikami, broni¹ i przyprawami. Pomiêdzy 1789 a 1805 walka o w³adzê pomiêdzy od³amami dynastii Al Saidów, rozpoczê³a powolny upadek imperium. GwoŸdziem do trumny dawnej potêgi ekonomicznej kraju by³o otwarcie kana³u sueskiego oraz wprowadzenie zakazu handlu niewolnikami i broni¹.

English: Once the greatest empire in existence, spanning three continents and ruling over hundreds of thousands of people the Ottoman Empire had declined by the late 19th century, to the point of being known as the 'sick man of europe'. An inability to industrialise, combined with the fierce conservative opposition to any reform whatsoever, meant that the Ottoman Sultanate had dropped back well behind the European powers by 1876, when Abdul Hamid II came to the throne. Attempts were made to change this, which although they failed, did lead to closer ties between German and the Empire, culminating in the beginning of construction of the Berlin-Baghdad railway in 1888. As the Great War began in Europe the Ottomans signed a treaty with the Germans and soon after joined the war against the Entente powers. Turkey's forces had begun to collapse by 1918 and seemed likely to surrender. However the renewed offensive in western Europe by the Germans drew many allied soldiers away from the Turkish theatre and with France's fall Germany was finally free to send troops into Turkey itself. The British were driven out of Baghdad and Jerusalem and soon after from out of Egypt too. When peace came in 1921 the Ottoman Empire gained Cyprus directly and a set of puppet governments in Albania, Armenia, Libya and Tunisia. The Berlin-Baghdad railway was finally completed and extended to Basra as well. However despite these victories the Sultanate remained unindustrialised and in desperate need of reform. Unfortunately the Germans had an interest in maintaining the status quo and so consistently backed the Sultans in any clashes with reformist groups, while at the same time letting the Sultan know that any reform on his part would lead to a withdrawal of their support. In 1936 then the Sultanate is staggering and slipping. More and more groups demanding reforms are appearing, to be joined by various nationalist groups intent on achieving independence. Economically too it is reliant on German support, especially the oil trade from the Middle East. In other words the Ottoman Empire is now the 'terminally ill man of Europe'.

When the Weltkrieg began no place under the sun of the British empire responded more loyally than India. "The swords of the martial princes leapt from their scabbards" as one reporter put it. From the trenches of the Western Front to the deserts of Arabia, the troops of the British Raj fought doggedly for its King-Emperor and the glory of battle. However, it was also the expectation of the nascent Indian national movement that their full support for the war effort would in turn translate into political reforms at home once the war had been concluded. As the Kaiserschlacht concluded the battles on the Western Front victoriously for the Central Powers and the campaign in the Middle East turned into a stalemate, Britain and her empire accepted Ludendorff's Peace With Honour in 1921. The defeat did not deter the Indian reform movement who now loudly demanded Home-Rule to be put in effect. The British response, galvanized by the loss in the Weltkrieg, was draconian. As the British reneged on their promises, the Indian National Congress became further radicalized and sabotage and terror soon became an all too common sight throughout the Raj. When the murder of 41 striking miners in Wales cast the Home Isles into the currents of Revolution, India soon followed suit. Desperately trying to maintain some influence on the sub-continent, the exiled Royalist government in Canada decided to grant India Home-Rule as a Dominion within the Empire under the leadership of Maharaja Ganga Singh of Bikaner. This, however, did little to calm the resurgent independence movement and thus, when the first elections were held the INC boycotted the ballots. This in turn brought a broad coalition of loyalist parties to power in Delhi, which held little legitimacy in Bombay and the Bengal, both centres of nationalist and socialist sentiment. The result was a bloody civil war when the INC declared their own provisional government in Calcutta, soon followed by a cabale of southern nationalist princes united behind the Nizam of Hyderabad. Despite early setbacks such as an invasion by the Afghans that saw Quetta and Peshawar ceded to Kabul, and defeats, Ganga Singh managed to rally the loyalist forces and defeat the aspirations of both Calcutta and Hyderabad, declaring himself governor-general for life in the process. 10 years later, an armed peace is still maintained on the sub-continent, but the Maharaja of Bikaner, in effect dictator of the Delhi Government, knows that his military government can't survive forever and the democratic opposition is already gathering its strength.

The history of the nation of Panama is irretrievably linked with its most famous feature: the Panama Canal. After the Columbian government resisted American attempts to build a canal through the Panamanian Isthmus, the United States encouraged the Panamanians to rise up against the Columbians then prevented the Columbians from crossing into Panama to put the insurrection down. The Panamanian declaration of independence was written in New York City and created Panama as a de-facto protectorate of the United States. Suffering, as most Western countries, from the Great Depression, Panamanian objections to non-canal related American commerce in the Canal Zone putting native industry out of business led to a new treaty in early 1936. The new treaty would lessen the United States' special rights in the Canal Zone, while still allowing for unilateral military action on the part of the United States in Panama if the United States found it necessary. While still firmly in the grip of the United States, these measures may not be able to still the budding tides of Panamanian anti-Yankee nationalism.
French: L’histoire du Panama est irrémédiablement liée à son principal attrait, le canal de Panama. Après la résistance colombienne aux tentatives américaines de construction d’un canal dans l’isthme de Panama, les Etats-Unis décident d’encourager les Panaméens à se révolter contre les Colombiens. Les Américains soutiennent la révolte en empêchant les anciens colons d’accéder au Panama pour mettre fin à la révolte. La déclaration d’indépendance du jeune pays est éditée à New York et désigne le pays comme étant un protectorat américain. Comme la plupart des pays occidentaux, les Etats-Unis sont frappés par la Grande Dépression. Dans ces conditions les réticences panaméennes au commerce américain dans la zone du canal sont résolues par un nouveau traité signé au début de l’année 1936. Celui-ci réduit les droits spécifiques des Américains dans la zone du canal mais n’abolit pas l’autorisation d’intervention militaire unilatérale des Américains au Panama s’ils la jugent nécessaire.  Ces mesures qui ne libèrent pas le pays de l’emprise de la superpuissance ne suffiront certainement pas à apaiser le nationalisme anti-yankee des Panaméens.
Italian: La storia della nazione di Panama è inevitabilmente legata a quella della sua caratteristica più importante, l'omonimo canale. Dopo che il governo colombiano resistette ai tentativi americani di costruire un canale attraverso l'istmo di Panama, gli Stati Uniti incoraggiarono una rivolta da parte dei panamensi, impedendo poi l'arrivo dei soldati colombiani per sedare la rivolta. La dichiarazione d'indipendenza panamense fu scritta a New York City e di fatto fece di Panama un protettorato americano. Colpita, come la maggior parte dei paesi occidentali, dalla grande depressione, il rifiuto di Panama di costruire il canale per non assecondare i commerci americani nella zona facendo fallire l'industria locale, portò a un nuovo trattato agli inizi del 1936, il quale avrebbe diminuito i diritti speciali degli Stati Uniti nella zona del canale, pur permettendo ancora azioni militari unilaterali da parte degli americani a Panama, qualora lo avessero ritenuto necessario. Nonostante Panama fosse ancora saldamente sotto la morsa degli U.S.A., queste misure si sarebbero rivelate inadeguate per arginare il crescente sentimento nazionalista anti-Yankee.
Spanish: La historia de la nación de Panamá está irremisiblemente ligada a su rasgo más famoso: el Canal de Panamá. Después de que el gobierno colombiano se resistiese a los intentos estadounidenses de construir un canal a través del istmo de Panamá, los Estados Unidos animaron a los panameños a rebelarse contra los colombianos y luego impidieron a éstos acceder a Panamá para sofocar la insurrección. La declaración de independencia de Panamá fue redactada en Nueva York y creó a Panamá como un protectorado de hecho de los Estados Unidos. Tras sufrir los efectos de la Gran Depresión, al igual que la mayoría de los países occidentales, las objeciones panameñas a que cualquier comercio estadounidense en la zona del canal que no estuviese directamente relacionado con él hundiese a la industria nativa llevaron a un nuevo tratado a principios de 1936. Éste reduciría los derechos especiales de los Estados Unidos en la zona, a la vez que seguía permitiendo intervenciones militares unilaterales en Panamá por parte de los Estados Unidos si éstos lo consideraban necesario. Aun siguiendo firmemente en poder de los Estados Unidos, estas medidas pueden no ser suficientes para apaciguar las nacientes corrientes de nacionalismo panameño antinorteamericano.
German: Die Geschichte der Nation Panama ist unlösbar verbunden mit seiner größten Berühmtheit, dem Panamakanal. Nachdem sich die kolumbianische Regierung amerikanischen Versuchen widersetzt hatte, einen Kanal durch den Isthmus von Panama zu bauen, spornten die USA die Bevölkerung Panamas an, sich gegen die Kolumbianer zu erheben und verweigerten diesen dann zur Niederschlagung des Aufstands den Zugang nach Panama. Die Unabhängigkeitserklärung Panamas wurde in New York City geschrieben und gab Panama den Status eines de facto-Protektorats der USA. Wie die meisten westlichen Länder litt auch Panama unter der Geißel der Großen Depression und Anfang 1936 führte der Protest Panamas gegen nicht kanalgebundenen Handel der USA, der die lokale Industrie in der Kanalzone in den Ruin trieb, zu einem neuen Abkommen. Dieses verringerte die Sonderrechte der USA in der Kanalzone, während es weiterhin unilaterale Militäraktionen seitens der USA in Panama erlaubte, sollten die USA dies für nötig halten. Panama ist aber immer noch fest im Griff der USA, und diese Maßnahmen könnten nicht ausreichen, den aufkommenden Anti-Yankee-Nationalismus in Panama einzudämmen.

English: The Great South American War of 1932-1935 started with a Bolivian invasion of Paraguay and ended with its occupation by Argentinian forces and the incorporation of the República Guaraní as a member state of the new Union of La Plata, with all its affairs being decided from far-away Buenos Aires. After many years of complete subservience, however, the government of Paraguay has regained its autonomy. Even with the end of the Platine War, however, South America is still a powderkeg, and many challanges still await the young republic.
French: Grâce à une économie autarcique et à la politique isolationniste du pays, le dictateur José Gasparo Rodriguez (1811/14 – 1840) parvient  à défendre l’intégrité paraguayenne contre les revendications territoriales de l’Argentine et du Brésil. Son neveu et successeur Carlos Antonio López (1844-1862) ouvre de nouveau les frontières afin d’entreprendre le développement économique et culturel du pays. Mais ses efforts sont brutalement interrompus sous le gouvernement de son fils, Francisco Solano López (1862-1870), qui concentre toute son attention sur la protection militaire des zones portuaires. Les actions de Francisco Solano López se soldent par l’entrée en guerre du pays contre la Triple Alliance (Argentine, Brésil et Uruguay) de 1865 à 1870. A l’issue de ce conflit, le Paraguay perd un quart de son territoire et plus de la moitié de sa population. A la mort de López, en 1870, l’assemblée nationale adopte une constitution libérale. Le parti libéral et le parti conservateur de l’Asociación Nacional republicana (Colorado) émergent en 1887. Après de nombreux coups d’Etat et révoltes, le pays se stabilise enfin sous le règne de Eligio Ayala (1924-1928).  A l’issue de la coûteuse guerre du Chaco contre la Bolivie (1932-1935), le Paraguay obtient la plus grande partie du Chaco et les régimes autoritaires se succèdent au gouvernement.
Italian: Il dittatore José Gasparo Rodriguez (1811/14-1840), conservò l'integrità del Paraguay contro le pretese argentine e brasiliane attraverso un'economia autosufficiente e chiudendo il suo paese politicamente. Il suo nipote e successore, Carlos Antonio López (1844-1862), aprì nuovamente il paese per promuovere lo sviluppo economico e culturale. Sotto suo figlio, Francisco Solano López (1862-1870), questi sforzi terminarono bruscamente col tentativo di assicurarsi l'accesso a un porto con la forza militare. La guerra che ne seguì, contro la triplice alleanza di Argentina, Brasile e Uruguay (1865-1870), terminò con la cocente sconfitta del Paraguay che perse un quarto del suo territorio e più della metà della propria popolazione. Dopo la morte di Lopez nel 1870, l'assemblea nazionale emanò una costituzione liberale. Il 1887 vide la fondazione del partito liberale e dell'Associazione Nazionale Republicana (Colorado) di stampo conservatrice. Dopo diverse rivolte e colpi di stato, la situazione si calmò sotto Eligio Ayala (1924-1928). Dopo la dispendiosa guerra del Chaco contro la Bolivia (1932-1935), che assicurò la parte più ampia del Chaco del nord al Paraguay, diversi regimi autoritari governarono il paese.
Spanish: El dictador José Gaspar Rodríguez (1811-14 y 1814-40) preservó la integridad de Paraguay frente a reivindicaciones argentinas y brasileñas gracias a una economía autosuficiente y al aislamiento político del país. Su sobrino y sucesor, Carlos Antonio López (1844-1862), rompió el aislamiento del país para promover el desarrollo económico y cultural. Bajo el mandato de su hijo, Francisco Solano López (1862-1870), estos esfuerzos llegaron a un brusco final cuando intentó hacerse con una salida al mar por medios militares. Esto llevó a una guerra devastadora contra la Triple Alianza de Argentina, Brasil y Uruguay (1865-1870), en la que Paraguay perdió un tercio de su territorio y más de la mitad de su población. Tras la muerte de López en 1870, la asamblea nacional promulgó una constitución liberal. 1887 vio la creación del Partido Liberal y la conservadora Asociación Nacional Republicana (Colorado). Tras continuas revueltas y golpes de estado, la situación se tranquilizó durante el mandato de Eligio Ayala (1924-1928). Tras la costosa Guerra del Chaco contra Bolivia (1932-1935), en la que Paraguay consiguió la mayor parte del Chaco Boreal, el país conoció una sucesión de regímenes autoritarios.
German: Diktator José Gasparo Rodriguez (1811/14 - 1840) bewahrte Paraguays Integrität gegenüber argentinischen und brasilianischen Forderungen mittels einer selbsttragenden Wirtschaft und politischer Abschottung nach außen. Seine Neffe und Nachfolger Carlos Antonio López (1844 - 1862) öffnete das Land erneut, um die wirtschaftliche und kulturelle Entwicklung zu fördern. Unter seinem Sohn Francisco Solano López (1862 - 1870) endeten diese Bemühungen abrupt, als dieser versuchte, sich mit Waffengewalt Zugang zu einem Hafen zu verschaffen. Dies führte zu einem verheerenden Krieg gegen die Dreierallianz Argentinien, Brasilien und Uruguay (1865 - 1870), in dem Paraguay ein Viertel seines Territoriums und über die Hälfte seiner Bevölkerung verlor. Nach López’ Tod 1870 verabschiedete die Nationalversammlung eine liberale Verfassung. 1887 wurde die Liberale Partei und die konservative Asociación Nacional Republicana (Colorado) gegründet. Nach permanenten Revolten und Staatsstreichen beruhigte sich die Situation unter Eligio Ayala (1924 - 1928). Nach dem verlustreichen Chaco-Krieg gegen Bolivien (1932 - 1935), in dem der größte Teil des Chaco Boreal an Paraguay fiel, wurde das Land nacheinander von mehreren autoritären Regimes beherrscht.

English: For nearly two centuries Persia, known to its people as Iran, has been precariously balanced between conflicting forces. Internally the elements of reform and westernization conflict with an increasingly conservative clergy. Internationally Persia was split, in 1907, into a Russian northern sphere and a British south, although it would never be a formal colony of either power. After several attempts at a constitutional monarchy in the first decades of the 20th Century, Persia was thrown into social, political, and economic chaos. Reza Khan, an army officer, finally staged a successful coup against the corrupt Qajar Dynasty in 1921. Though the intent was originally to proclaim a republic, pressure from the conservative clergy (who feared being left out of any republican power structure) convinced now Prime Minister Reza Khan to crown himself Reza Shah Pahlavi. Strongly authoritarian and nationalistic, Reza Shah soon began a vigorous program of industrialization and secular reform, establishing universities, improving infrastructure, establishing public education, and reducing the influence of the mullahs, thereby laying the foundations for a modern, secular Iranian state. Just as important as modernization and secularizing, however, was his determination that Persia maintain its independence. Even if the British and the Russian are no longer in the position to influence Persia, the new neighbours which emerged in the recent years might try to extend their authority over Persia. In fact, the defense of the country is the matter most often debated in the Persian government.
French: La Perse, connue par son peuple sous le nom d’Iran, est tiraillée entre deux forces contradictoires depuis près de deux siècles. Les partisans de la réforme et de l’occidentalisation s’opposent à un clergé de plus en plus conservateur. En 1907, le territoire perse est partagé entre deux puissances européennes, la Russie en occupe la partie nord et la Grande-Bretagne les régions du sud mais le pays ne sera jamais véritablement colonisé. Après les nombreux échecs de mise en place d’une monarchie constitutionnelle pendant les premières décennies du 20e siècle, la Perse sombre dans un chaos social, économique et politique. L’officier militaire Reza Khan réussit finalement à renverser la dynastie corrompue des Qadjars, en 1921. Le clergé conservateur (qui a peur d’être exclu du pouvoir décisionnel d’un gouvernement républicain) convainc le premier ministre Reza Khan de se faire couronner Reza Chah Pahlavi. Le dirigeant autoritaire et nationaliste engage une politique d’industrialisation et de réforme laïque. Il fait construire des universités, améliore l’infrastructure, instaure l’école publique et réduit le pouvoir des mullahs posant ainsi les fondements d’un Etat iranien moderne et laïque.  Le Chah accorde également une grande importance à l’indépendance de la Perse face aux ambitions expansionnistes de l’URSS et à l’intérêt que manifeste la Grande-Bretagne pour ses ressources pétrolières. La solution réside peut-être dans l’intervention d’une troisième force capable de libérer la Perse de l’emprise britannique et russe.
Italian: Per quasi due secoli, la Persia, conosciuta dalla sua gente come Iran, è stata in precario equilibrio fra diverse forze in conflitto. Internamente gli elementi della riforma e dell'occidentalizzazione contrastavano con un clero sempre più conservatore. Sul piano internazionale, nel 1907 la Persia venne divisa in due parti, il nord sotto il controllo russo e il sud con gli inglesi, pur non essendo mai stata una colonia di nessuno di questi due stati. Dopo diversi tentativi di instaurare una monarchia costituzionale nei primi decenni del ventesimo secolo, la Persia si ritrovò in una situazione di caos politico, sociale ed economico. Nel 1921, Reza Khan, un ufficiale dell'esercito, era riuscito a condurre un colpo di stato contro la corrotta dinastia Qajar. Anche se l'intenzione originale era quella di proclamare una repubblica, le pressioni provenienti dal clero conservatore (che temeva di essere lasciato fuori da una struttura di potere repubblicana), convinsero il primo ministro Reza Khan a incoronarsi come scià Reza Pahlavi. Fortemente autoritario e nazionalista, Reza Shah divenne presto un energico programma di industrializzazione e riforma secolari, con la costruzione di università, il miglioramento delle infrastrutture e l'istituzione dell'istruzione pubblica, ponendo le basi per un moderno, secolare stato iraniano. La determinazione di Reza Pahlavi a mantenere l'indipendenza del paese contro le mire espansionistiche e petrolifere avanzate da inglesi e russi, fu un altro importante elemento, al pari della modernizzazione e secolarizzazione. Forse la soluzione consisteva in una terza forza in grado di liberare la Persia dall'influenza russa e inglese?
Spanish: Durante casi dos siglos, Persia, llamada Irán por su gente, ha mantenido un equilibrio precario entre fuerzas enfrentadas. En el plano interior, los elementos de reforma y occidentalización chocan con un clero cada vez más conservador. En el plano internacional, en 1907 Persia se dividió en un ámbito septentrional ruso y uno meridional inglés, aunque nunca llegó a ser una colonia oficial de ninguno de los dos países. Tras varios intentos de instaurar una monarquía constitucional en las primeras décadas del siglo XX, Persia se vio sumida en un caos social, político y económico. En 1921, Reza Kan, un oficial del ejército, consiguió finalmente dar con éxito un golpe de estado contra la corrupta dinastía Qajar. Su intención inicial era proclamar una república, pero las presiones del clero conservador (que temían quedarse fuera de cualquier estructura de poder republicana) convencieron al ahora primer ministro Reza Khan de que se coronase a sí mismo como el sha Reza Pahlevi. Firmemente autoritario y nacionalista, el sha Reza inició con prontitud un programa de industrialización y de reformas seculares, fundando universidades, mejorando infraestructuras, instituyendo educación pública y reduciendo la influencia de los mulahs, estableciendo así los cimientos para un estado iraní moderno y secular. Sin embargo, tan importante como la modernización y la secularización fue su decisión de mantener la independencia de Persia frente a la expansión soviética y los intereses británicos por las reservas de petróleo del país. ¿Será que la solución es una tercera fuerza que pueda liberar a Persia de las influencias británica y soviética?
German: Fast zwei Jahrhunderte lang hatte sich Persien, seinen Einwohnern als Iran bekannt, in einer prekären Balance zwischen sich konkurrierenden Kräften befunden. Intern kollidierten die Elemente Reform und Verwestlichung mit immer konservativeren Geistlichen. International wurde Persien 1907 in eine russische Nordhälfte und einen britischen Süden gespalten, obwohl es nie eine formelle Kolonie einer der beiden Mächte werden sollte. Nach verschiedenen Versuchen zu Beginn des 20. Jahrhunderts, eine konstitutionelle Monarchie einzuführen, versank Persien in sozialem, politischem und wirtschaftlichem Chaos. Der Offizier Resa Khan zog schließlich 1921 einen erfolgreichen Coup gegen die korrupte Qajar-Dynasty durch. Obwohl seine Absicht ursprünglich die Errichtung einer Republik gewesen war, überzeugten die konservativen Geistlichen (die bei einer republikanischen Machtstruktur totale Machtverlust fürchteten) Resa Khan, nun Premierminister, sich als Resa Schah Pahlawi zu krönen. Stark autoritär und nationalistisch, begann Resa Schah bald mit einem lebendigen Programm der Industrialisierung und weltlicher Reform, errichtete Universitäten, modernisierte die Infrastruktur, erschuf ein öffentliches Bildungssystem und legte das Fundament für einen modernen und weltlichen iranischen Staat. Genau so wichtig wie Modernisierung und Säkularisierung war aber auch seine Entschlossenheit, Persiens Unabhängigkeit angesichts sowjetischer Expansion und britischem Interesse an den Ölreserven seines Landes zu bewahren. Vielleicht ist die Lösung eine dritte Kraft, die Persien von sowjetischem und britischem Einfluss befreit?

English: The Phillipines had not achieved full independence from American control in 1936, but they were closer to it. The Tydings-McDuffie Act had been passed in 1934, creating the Commonwealth of the Phillipines with an elected government under Manuel Quezon and a constitution based upon that of the United States. While technically an independent state, the United States retained control of the foreign affairs and military until the official date of July 4th 1946, when the Commonwealth of the Phillpines would become the Republic of the Phillipines and achieve true independence. Yet, though they could not be seen quite so clearly at the start of 1936, storm clouds were building and the status of the Phillipines as an American protectorate could have dire consequences for the country's future....
French: En 1936, les Philippines ne se sont pas encore libérées intégralement de l’emprise américaine mais semblent en bonne voie. Le traité de Tydings-McDuffie signé en 1934, établit le Commonwealth des Philippines sous la direction du gouvernement démocratiquement élu de Manuel Quezon. La nouvelle constitution du pays s’inspire en grande partie de celle appliquée aux Etats-Unis. L’Etat est techniquement indépendant mais les Etats-Unis contrôlent officiellement les affaires étrangères et militaires jusqu’au 4 juillet 1946, date à laquelle le Commonwealth des Philippines passe au statut de République totalement indépendante. Contrairement aux apparences, le statut philippin de protectorat américain en 1936 aurait pu avoir de graves conséquences pour le pays...
Italian: Nel 1936 le Filippine non raggiunsero la completa indipendenza dagli americani, ma ci andarono vicine. Il documento Tydings-McDuffie fu approvato nel 1934, dando origine al Commonwealth delle Filippine con un governo eletto sotto Manuel Quezon e una costituzione basata su quella degli Stati Uniti. Pur essendo uno stato tecnicamente indipendente, gli Stati Uniti conservarono il controllo degli affari esteri e militari fino alla data ufficiale del 4 luglio 1946, quando il Commonwealth delle Filippine diventò la Repubblica delle Filippine, raggiungendo l'indipendenza totale. Tuttavia, la situazione agli inizi del 1936 non era così rosea, data la minaccia di un imminente conflitto mondiale, e lo status di protettorato americano delle Filippine avrebbe potuto avere conseguenze terribili sul futuro del paese...
Spanish: En 1936, Filipinas no había conseguido independizarse totalmente de Estados Unidos, pero estaban más cerca de lograrlo. La Ley Tydings-McDuffie, aprobada en 1934, había creado la Commonwealth de Filipinas con un gobierno electo liderado por Manuel Quezón y una constitución basada en la de los Estados Unidos. Aunque técnicamente era un estado independiente, los Estados Unidos mantuvieron el control sobre su política exterior y militar hasta la fecha oficial del 4 de julio de 1946, cuando la Commonwealth de Filipinas se convierte en la República de las Filipinas y consigue ser verdaderamente independiente. Pero, aunque eso no podía verse con tanta claridad a principios de 1936, las nubes oscurecían el horizonte y la condición de Filipinas como protectorado estadounidense podría tener consecuencias nefastas para el futuro del país...
German: Die Philippinen hatten es bis 1936 noch nicht geschafft, sich vollständig der amerikanischen Kontrolle zu entziehen, waren ihrem Ziel jedoch ein Stück näher gerückt. Basierend auf dem Tydings-McDuffie-Gesetz von 1934 war ein Philippinisches Commonwealth mit einer gewählten Regierung unter Manuel Quezon und einer auf der Verfassung der USA basierenden Konstitution geschaffen worden. Obwohl die Philippinen damit rein technisch gesehen ein unabhängiger Staat waren, behielten die USA bis zum 4. Juli 1946, als das Philippinische Commonwealth zur Philippinischen Republik wurde und damit wahre Unabhängigkeit erlangte, die Kontrolle über die Außenpolitik und das Militär. Zu Beginn des Jahres 1936 konnte man die dunklen Wolken noch nicht sehen, die sich am Horizont zusammenzogen und furchtbaren Konsequenzen für die Philippinen als amerikanisches Protektorat verkündeten...

English: Until the end of the Weltkrieg, there was no Poland. What had been Polish territory had been carved up between Austria, Russia, and Prussia at the end of the 18th century, and in the face of scattered uprisings throughout the 19th those three nations continued to hold on to their Polish territory. Polish fortunes turned in 1918, though, with the signing of the treaty of Brest-Litovsk, where it was granted authonomy from the collapsing Russia. However, this triumph came with a bitter taste, as the election of a polish king was postponed again and again between 1921 and 1936 as Austria-Hungary and Germany squabbled about the nationality of a possible king and the exact status of a polish kingdom. Hence, the regency of Janusz Radziwill continues. However, all hope of a polish kingdom is not over - the ausgleich of 1937 is eagerly looked forward to in Warsaw as the time when the future of Poland is decided. However, certain forces in Warsaw are tired of beeing under the austro-german yoke, and looks towards their 'enslaved' brothers in Germany, Austria and the eastern states, hoping to one day create a kingdom for all Poles. Whatever the future holds in store for Poland, it will go down as years as important to polish history as 1772, 1793 and 1795 - and possibly more beneficent ones as well...
French: La Pologne n’existe pas en tant que pays indépendant avant la fin de la Grande Guerre. Le territoire qu’occupe aujourd’hui la Pologne est partagé entre l’Autriche, la Russie et la Prusse à la fin du 18e siècle. Les nombreuses révoltes qui marquent le 19e siècle n’empêchent pas les trois nations de poursuivre l’occupation. En 1918, la révolution russe et la défaite que subissent l’Autriche et l’Allemagne permet toutefois aux Polonais de se libérer de l’emprise des trois nations qui dominaient jusqu’alors leur pays. Le dirigeant polonais Józef Pilsudski profite de la situation pour déclarer la Pologne indépendante dès le 11 novembre 1918. La Pologne devient définitivement une nation libre après la guerre qui oppose son peuple au jeune Etat soviétique. Malgré le renversement de son régime démocratique lors d’un coup d’Etat intenté en 1926, la Pologne vit en 1936 une période prospère caractérisée par l’amélioration significative du niveau de vie, la baisse du taux de chômage et une économie en plein essor. Le sort de la Pologne reste cependant incertain compte tenu de sa situation géographique, le pays est effectivement coincé entre l’Union Soviétique et la nouvelle Allemagne qui souhaiteraient toutes les deux éradiquer la Pologne de l’échiquier mondial.
Italian: Fino al termine della Grande Guerra, la Polonia non esisteva. Quello che sarebbe poi diventato il territorio polacco fu ricavato tra Austria, Russia e Prussia alla fine del diciottesimo secolo e a fronte delle varie rivolte nel corso del diciannovesimo secolo queste tre nazioni riuscirono a impossessarsi della propria fetta di territorio polacco. Nel 1918, tuttavia, i polacchi si ritrovarono a veder crollare tutti i loro ex padroni, dato che la Russia dovette affrontare la rivoluzione mentre la Germania e l'Austria venivano sconfitte dagli alleati. Senza perdere tempo, il leader polacco Jozef Pilsudski proclamò l'indipendenza l'11 novembre 1918, e dopo un'aspra guerra per difendersi dal neonato stato russo, la Polonia divenne ufficialmente una nazione libera. Anche dopo aver perso il regime democratico in seguito a un colpo di stato (1926), il paese continuò a prosperare fino al 1936, con l'aumento dello standard di vita, la diminuzione della disoccupazione e il recupero dell'economia. Tuttavia, il destino della Polonia sembrava sempre più incerto, dato che il paese si trovava schiacciato fra la Russia e una Germania in fase di ricrescita, entrambe le quali sarebbero state liete di vederla sparire.
Spanish: Polonia no existía como tal antes del final de la Gran Guerra. Lo que había sido territorio polaco se había dividido entre Austria, Rusia y Prusia a finales del siglo XVIII y, pese a las diversas rebeliones a lo largo del siglo XIX, las tres naciones siguieron aferradas a sus territorios polacos. Sin embargo, para 1918, los polacos se encontraron en la singularísima circunstancia de ver cómo todos sus antiguos subyugadores se desmoronaban: Rusia, víctima de una revolución, y Alemania y Austria derrotadas por los Aliados. Sin perder ni un instante, el líder polaco Joszef Pilsudski declaró la independencia de Polonia el 11 de noviembre de 1918 y, tras una enconada guerra para contener al recién formado estado soviético, Polonia se convirtió oficialmente en una nación libre. Aunque perdió su régimen democrático en un golpe de estado en 1926, en 1936 Polonia era un estado próspero, con el nivel de vida en ascenso, el desempleo en descenso y la economía en vías de recuperación. Pero la suerte de Polonia parece cada vez más incierta, al verse encajonada entre la Rusia Soviética y una renaciente Alemania, a quienes les encantaría ver a Polonia desaparecer del mapa.
German: Bis zum Ende des Ersten Weltkriegs war Polen nicht existent. Das polnische Gebiet war Ende des 18. Jahrhunderts zwischen Österreich, Russland und Preußen aufgeteilt worden. Angesichts der niedergeschlagenen Aufstände im Laufe des 19. Jahrhunderts beschlossen diese drei Nationen, ihr jeweiliges polnisches Territorium zu behalten. 1918 befanden sich die Polen jedoch in einer einzigartigen Situation, da alle drei Besatzungsmächte zusammengebrochen waren: In Russland tobte eine Revolution, Deutschland und Österreich waren von den Alliierten besiegt worden. Der polnische Führer Jozef Pilsudski verschwendete daher keine Zeit und erklärte am 11. November 1918 die Unabhängigkeit Polens. Nach einem erbitterten Verteidigungskrieg mit der neu formierten Sowjetunion konnte sich Polen dann offiziell als freie Nation bezeichnen. Obwohl sein demokratisches Regime 1926 durch einen Staatsstreich gestürzt worden war, erholte sich Polen bis zum Jahr 1936 prächtig: Der Lebensstandard war gestiegen, die Arbeitslosenquote gesunken und die Wirtschaft erholte sich bestens. Dennoch scheint das Schicksal Polens ungewiss, da es zwischen dem sowjetischen Russland und dem wiedererstarkten Deutschland eingeklemmt ist. Und jedes dieser beiden Länder hätte nichts dagegen, wenn Polen von der Landkarte verschwinden würde...

English: Portugal, once a monarchy, then a republic, and now a decrepit dictatorship. During the 19th century, the country was marked by the internal struggles between republicans and supporters of a constitutional monarchy, which caused a deep rift in the country. In 1910, a coup by republican officers against Emanuel II abolished the rule of the Royal House of Braganca. Teófilo Fernandes Braga became the first president, proclaiming civil liberties and emancipating women in family law. A land reform programme failed, however, due to opposition from the aristocracy. By 1914, German troops in Africa started harassing Portuguese positions in Angola and Mozambique. Despite the fragile political situation, not to mention strong pro-German sentiment in both public and government, Portugal declared war on the German Empire on March 1916 and allied with the Entente during the Weitkrieg. The CEP - "Corpo Expedicionário Português" ("Portuguese Expeditionary Corps") was formed and dispatched to France in May 1917, participating in the disastrous Battle of the Lys in April 1918. In only four hours of fighting, the Portuguese forces lost over 7.500 men. As news reached Lisbon, a major crisis ensued, as Sidónio Pais carried a coup and overthrew the weak First Republic. The "Nova República" ("New Republic") was established with himself as president, and the Portuguese forces decided shift their efforts from Europe to protection of the African colonies. As the war was over, in 1921, the merchant marine suffered heavy losses from the German U-Boats, and trade with the colonies had collapsed, but the Portuguese colonial empire was left intact due to the Peace with Honour accords. As the country itself was relativelly unscatched, Sidónio Pais's popularity and power rose to unprecedent levels, which allowed for a curbing of any possible army revolt. For eight years, he had supreme power in the country, until the rise of Carmona and Salazar. Due to internal power struggles, the duo managed to remove Sidónio Pais from power in mid-1926. After ten years and many crisis and corruption scandals - most blamed on Carmona's weak personality -, and foreign threats in the form of expansionist Mittelafrika and the unstable Spanish government, the New Republic is nothing but a weak dictatorship bearing little to no resemblance to the previous era. With anti-dicatorship sentiment on the rise, the question is no longer IF the regime will fall, but WHEN and WHO shall rise from its ashes. Will the democratic forces assemble and bring stability to the nation? Will the monarchist movement be ready to restore the House of Braganza and bring Portugal back to its path of glory? Are the reactionary forces of the military ready to show their true face and do what the country needs the most? Sidónio Pais may also return to politics, rally the people for his cause and build a regime that will beat the test of time. Even Salazar, if by any luck he survives, will more than likelly create a monster far worse than the New Republic could ever be.

Siberia and the Russian far-east had been major areas of conflict during the Russian Civil War, as the location of a short-lived democratic republic, the rising of the 'Czech legion' and Japanese intervention. While forced to evacuate their forces due to German pressure (as well as intense resistance from local Cossacks), the Japanese remained eager to extend their influence and in 1922 pushed for the establishment of an independent state in the Transamur region. This motion gained the support of the Vladivostok business community, despite the fact that it left them vulnerable to forming an economic dependency on Japan. The majority of the business community however saw economic and diplomatic relations with the rising power in the East as a significant advantage, especially when compared to the alternative of being sucked further into the disorder besetting the rest of Russia. The new nation gained a prominent figurehead in the form of Admiral Kolchak, one of the more successful White Generals of the civil war and the one-time self-proclaimed 'Supreme Ruler of All Russia', who had been forced to flee Russia following his unsuccessful attempt to seize control in 1924. In 1936, the Transamur Republic has become a corporate and militaristic state, and is politically, economically and militarily under the thumb of the Japanese Empire. But Kolchak has goals of his own. Could he simply be playing a very dangerous game, using the Japanese protection to establish his own rule, first over Siberia, and then over Russia as a whole?

When revolution swept through the British Home Isles it precipitated a much wider and far more bloodier social upheaval in the jewel in the crown of British Imperialism, India. In late 1925, the British government reached an accord with a conservative-liberal coalition of Indian civil servants, politicians and princes that resulted in the signing of the Anglo-Indian Treaty, effectively granting India home-rule as a dominion within the British Commonwealth. However, these concessions were a little too late for the leadership of the Indian National Congress who, inspired by the events in London, convened a provisional government in Calcutta in the Bengal. When the new Indian government in Delhi attempted to enforce its authority against the leftist provisional government in Calcutta civil war broke out. The war raged across the Gangetic Plain and the Deccan Plateau, becoming ever more furious as the southern princes rebelled from the Delhi government, and British intervention began to arrive. However, in 1928 an uneasy truce had descended on the sub-continent as both Calcutta and Delhi were plagued by internal discord and martially exhausted. The truce settled into an armed peace as all three governments (Hyderabad taking on the name of a so-called National Government) began to consolidate their rule and apparatus of state in their respective provinces. The Bhartiya Commune, with its core in the revolutionary tradition of the Bengal commenced  a series of reforms aimed at improving women and minority rights, abolishing serfdom and landlordism whilst ever standing guard around the legacy of the Indian revolution. Now 10 years after the first Indian Civil War, the three competing states seem to be gathering steam for a new round of conflict over the legacy of the late British Raj.

Although factually independent since 1821, Spain recognized the autonomy of her former colony not until 1871 when a peace between the countries was struck after a conflict of the two countries over the Chinchain Islands. An alliance with Bolivia drew the country 1879 till 1883 in a border conflict between Chile and Bolivia in the Atacama Desert (Saltpeter War). During the war Peru lost her provinces of Tarapacá, Arica, and Tacna. British and U.S. financial circles exploited the opportunity, stripping the weakened Peruvian state of their state railroad, nullifying Peru's debts in exchange. Between 1895 and 1930 the domestic situation was consolidated. Newly discovered copper deposits made up for the loss of the Saltpeter provinces for which Peru was compensated in the Treaty of Lima 1929, getting free port access to Arica, receiving back the province of Tacna, and 6 million Dollars. The socialist APRA (Allianza Popular Revolucionaria Americana, founded in 1924) under Victor Raúl Haya de la Torre demanded a land reform and the political and social integration of the Indios who made up 50 percent of the population. In 1931 and 1936 Haya de la Torre failed in the elections. The successes of his party, however, alarmed the military under Oscar Raimundo Benavides who banned the party.
French: Le Pérou est officiellement indépendant depuis 1821, mais l’Espagne ne reconnaît le nouveau statut de sa colonie qu’en 1871, lorsqu’une paix est signée entre les deux pays à l’issue du conflit qui les opposait pour la possession des îles Chincha. L’alliance avec la Bolivie entraîne le pays dans un conflit frontalier entre le Chili et la Bolivie dans le désert d’Atacama (guerre du Pacifique). Au cours de cette guerre, le Pérou perd les provinces de Tarapacá, d’Arica et de Tacna. Les financiers britanniques et américains profitent de la situation pour déposséder le fragile Etat péruvien de son chemin de fer national en promettant, en échange, d’annuler les dettes du pays. Entre 1895 et 1930, la situation intérieure se stabilise. La découverte de mines de cuivre permet de compenser la perte des provinces péruviennes du salpêtre. A l’issue du traité de Lima de 1929, le pays bénéficie toutefois d’un accès libre au port d’Arica, de la réintégration de la province de Tacna et d’une compensation financière de 6 millions de dollars. La chute du président Leguías après les ravages de la Grande Dépression plonge le pays dans un climat de troubles et de tensions politiques. La parti socialiste de l’APRA (Allianza Popular Revolucionaria Americana), fondé en 1924 et dirigé par Raúl Haya de la Torre, réclame une réforme terrienne ainsi que l’intégration politique et sociale de la population indienne constituant 50 pour cent de la population péruvienne.  Haya de la Torre perd les élections de 1931 et 1936. La popularité de son parti inquiète toutefois le gouvernement militaire dirigé par Oscar Raimundo Benavides qui décide d’interdire le parti.
Italian: Anche se di fatto indipendente dal 1821, la Spagna riconobbe l'autonomia del Perù non prima del 1871, con la pace siglata fra i due paesi alle isole Chinchain. Un'alleanza con la Bolivia, trascinò il paese dal 1879 al 1883 in un conflitto al confine, fra Cile e Bolivia nel deserto Atacama (guerra del salnitro). Durante la guerra, il Perù perse le province di Tarapacá, Arica e Tacna. I circoli finanziari inglesi e americani approfittarono dell'occasione, togliendo al debole stato peruviano la sua ferrovia in cambio dell'azzeramento del debito pubblico. Fra il 1895 e il 1930, la situazione interna si consolidò. La scoperta di nuovi depositi di rame rimpiazzò la perdita delle province del salnitro, per le quali il Perù venne compensato col trattato di Lima (1929), ottenendo libero accesso al porto di Arica e ottenendo la restituzione della provincia di Tacna oltre a 6 milioni di dollari. Con la grande depressione e la conseguente caduta del presidente Leguías, il clima negli affari interni si raffreddò. L'Alleanza Popolare Rivoluzionaria Americana (APRA) socialista, fondata nel 1924 sotto Victor Raúl Haya de la Torre, chiese una riforma della terra e l'integrazione politica e sociale degli Indio, che rappresentavano il 50 percento della popolazione. Nel 1931 e nel 1936, Haya de la Torre non venne eletto. Tuttavia, i successi del suo schieramento allarmarono i militari guidati da Oscar Raimundo Benavides, i quali bandirono il partito.
Spanish: Aunque teóricamente independiente desde 1821, España no reconoció la autonomía de su antigua colonia hasta 1871, cuando se firmó un tratado de paz entre ambos países tras un enfrentamiento por las Islas de Chincha. Una alianza con Bolivia arrastró entre 1879 y 1883 al país a un conflicto fronterizo entre Chile y Bolivia en el desierto de Atacama (la Guerra del Nitrato). Durante esta guerra, Perú perdió las provincias de Tarapacá, Arica y Tacna. Los círculos financieros de Gran Bretaña y Estados Unidos aprovecharon la oportunidad para despojar al estado peruano de sus ferrocarriles estatales, anulando a cambio las deudas que Perú mantenía con ellos. La situación interna se consolidó entre 1895 y 1930. El descubrimiento de nuevos yacimientos de cobre compensó la pérdida de las provincias ricas en nitrato, por las que Perú fue indemnizada en el Tratado de Lima de 1929 con la concesión de acceso portuario libre a Arica, la devolución de la provincia de Tacna y 6 millones de dólares. Con la Gran Depresión y la subsiguiente caída del presidente Leguías, el clima se fue enfriando en la política interior. Los socialistas de la APRA (Alianza Popular Revolucionaria Americana, fundada en 1924), al mando de Víctor Raúl Haya de la Torre, exigieron una reforma agraria y la integración social y política de los indios, que componían el 50 por ciento de la población. Haya de la Torre fracasó en las elecciones de 1931 y 1936. Sin embargo, los éxitos de su partido alarmaron al ejército, al mando de Óscar Raimundo Benavides, que ilegalizó al partido.
German: Trotz ihrer de facto-Unabängigkeit seit 1821 erkannte Spanien die Autonomie seiner früheren Kolonie nicht vor 1871 an, als nach einem Konflikt der beiden Länder um die Chinchain-Inseln ein Frieden zwischen den beiden Ländern geschlossen wurde. Eine Allianz mit Bolivien zog das Land 1879 bis 1883 in einen Grenzkonflikt zwischen Chile und Bolivien in der Atacama-Wüste (Salpeterkrieg) hinein. Während des Krieges verlor Peru seine Provinzen Tarapacá, Arica und Tacna. Britische und amerikanische Finanzkreise nutzen die Gelegenheit, dem geschwächten peruanischen Staat seine Eisenbahn abzunehmen und im Gegenzug Perus Schulden zu annullieren. Zwischen 1895 und 1930 wurde die innenpolitische Situation gefestigt: Neu entdeckte Kupfervorkommen glichen den Verlust der Salpeterprovinzen aus, für den Peru im Abkommen von Lima 1929 entschädigt wurde: Es erhielt freien Hafenzugang zu Arica, bekam die Provinz Tacna wieder, sowie 6 Millionen Dollar. Mit der Großen Depression und dem darauffolgenden Präsidenten Leguías kühlte sich das innenpolitische Klima ab: Die sozialistische APRA (Allianza Popular Revolucionaria Americana, gegründet 1924) unter Victor Raúl Haya de la Torre verlangte eine Landreform und die politische und soziale Integration der Indios, welche 50 Prozent der Bevölkerung ausmachten. 1931 und 1936 verlor Haya de la Torre die Wahlen. Die Erfolge seiner Partei aber alarmierten das Militär unter Oscar Raimundo Benavides, der die Partei verbieten ließ.

English: Following the Union of the Principalities of Wallachia and Moldova under Cuza in 1859, the coronation of King Carol I, a German-borne prince, in 1866 and the achieving of complete independence from the Otoman Empire in 1878 Romania began its slow process of modernization and of turning to the west. In 1913 it entered the Second Balkans War, tipping the balance against Bulgaria and subsequently annexing southern Dobrogea from them. With the outbreak of WW1 in 1914 Romania initially remained neutral but would join the Entente in 1916, led by Carol's successor Ferdinand. After a failed attempt to invade Transylvania, nearly 2/3 of the country was occupied by the Central Powers. Even though the army fought an effective defensive war from its last remaining holdout in Moldova, the government was forced, following the Russian collapse, to sign the Treaty of Bucharest in 1918, handing over the southern half of the country and having the economy subjugated. The treaty was never ratified and by the end of the Weltkrieg a new treaty consisting of milder terms was drawn. The southern part of Dobrogea was returned to Bulgaria, Oltenia was de-militarized, the oilfields were leased to Germany until 2012 and various other sectors of the economy became dominated by German and Austrian companies, with Romania getting the province of Bessarabia from the fallen Tsarist Empire in return. After the death of Ferdinand in 1927, the military managed to effectively seize the reigns of government, installing the 6 year old Mihai, Ferdinand’s grandson, as their puppet king, completely bypassing Carol II, the old king’s disgraced son. Of the various political groups the generals co-opted, the extremist right-wing Iron Guard led by Corneliu Zelea Codreanu proved the most dangerous. He and his organization managed in time to acquire more and more power within the state apparatus, co-opting many army generals and other influential leaders, eventually violently ousting the part of the military government still opposing him in 1935 and setting himself up as head of state, just as the young king fled the country. Codreanu now rules over a divided nation, promising to restore Romania to its former greatness, throw off the shackles of its oppression and be rid of its enemies both foreign and domestic.

The southern part of Dobrogea was returned to Bulgaria, Oltenia was de-militarized, the oilfields were leased to Germany until 2012 and various other sectors of the economy became dominated by German and Austrian companies, with Romania getting the province of Bessarabia from the fallen Tsarist Empire in return. After the death of Ferdinand in 1927, the military managed to effectively seize the reigns of government, installing the 6 year old Mihai, Ferdinand’s grandson, as their puppet king, completely bypassing Carol II, the old king’s disgraced son. Of the various political groups the generals co-opted, the extremist right-wing Iron Guard led by Corneliu Zelea Codreanu proved the most dangerous. He and his organization managed in time to acquire more and more power within the state apparatus, co-opting many army generals and other influential leaders, eventually violently ousting the part of the military government still opposing him in 1935 and setting himself up as head of state, just as the young king fled the country. Codreanu now rules over a divided nation, promising to restore Romania to its former greatness, throw off the shackles of its oppression and be rid of its enemies both foreign and domestic.
Polish: Following the Union of the Principalities of Wallachia and Moldova under Cuza in 1859, the coronation of King Carol I, a German-borne prince, in 1866 and the achieving of complete independence from the Otoman Empire in 1878 Romania began its slow process of modernization and of turning to the west. In 1913 it entered the Second Balkans War, tipping the balance against Bulgaria and subsequently annexing southern Dobrogea from them. With the outbreak of WW1 in 1914 Romania initially remained neutral but would join the Entente in 1916, led by Carol's successor Ferdinand. After a failed attempt to invade Transylvania, nearly 2/3 of the country was occupied by the Central Powers. Even though the army fought an effective defensive war from its last remaining holdout in Moldova, the government was forced, following the Russian collapse, to sign the Treaty of Bucharest in 1918, handing over the southern half of the country and having the economy subjugated. The treaty was never ratified and by the end of the Weltkrieg a new treaty consisting of milder terms was drawn. The southern part of Dobrogea was returned to Bulgaria, Oltenia was de-militarized, the oilfields were leased to Germany until 2012 and various other sectors of the economy became dominated by German and Austrian companies, with Romania getting the province of Bessarabia from the fallen Tsarist Empire in return. After the death of Ferdinand in 1927, the military managed to effectively seize the reigns of government, installing the 6 year old Mihai, Ferdinand’s grandson, as their puppet king, completely bypassing Carol II, the old king’s disgraced son. Of the various political groups the generals co-opted, the extremist right-wing Iron Guard led by Corneliu Zelea Codreanu proved the most dangerous. He and his organization managed in time to acquire more and more power within the state apparatus, co-opting many army generals and other influential leaders, eventually violently ousting the part of the military government still opposing him in 1935 and setting himself up as head of state, just as the young king fled the country. Codreanu now rules over a divided nation, promising to restore Romania to its former greatness, throw off the shackles of its oppression and be rid of its enemies both foreign and domestic.

English: The kingdom of Naples had ruled southern Italy up until its annexation into the unified kingdom of Italy in 1860. With the collapse of Italy at the end of the Great War the victorious Central Powers chose to resurrect the nation as part of their 'divide and weaken' plan for the peninsula, setting up a puppet king on the throne. Surprisingly for the Austrians, there was much opposition to this plan from the traditionally conservative peasantry, which was so strong as to result in a series of uprisings. At the same time Anarcho-Syndicalist movements began to grow in the new state, and encouraged by events elsewhere in the world became increasingly aggressive. Before long Southern Italy were in chaos, a chaos which lasted for the next year and a half. Many Syndicalist leaders in northern Italy, who were unable to do act due to the Austrian occupation, migrated south and served to further fuel the growing Syndicalist groups there, and they encouraged political alliances with the anarchists, which allowed them to increase their power greatly. In February 1921 the Anarcho-Syndicalists felt ready to launch the revolution, which was joined by large parts of the deeply discontent peasantry, who saw it primarily as a chance to rid southern Italy of Austrian influences. After two months of civil war the Anarcho-Syndicalists triumphed, the ‘Socialist Republic of Italy’ was declared in April 1921, and an alliance with France forged. With Germany’s refusal to intervene Austria was grudgingly forced to recognise the new regime. In the 15 years since the Republic’s founding it has slowly rebuilt and attempted to industrialise itself, strengthening its economy and military as it plans how best to reunify Italy and once more create a united Italian Republic.

At the Congress of Omsk in April 1919, the White Generals agreed to form a united political front behind Alexander Kerensky and the remaining forces of the Provisional Government.  The united White forces, joined by the republic of Finland, made considerable gains, but the Red Army was still too strong and well placed, dominating the Russian industrial heartland and transportation networks. But soon the German empire, fearing the success of a dangerous ideology, decided to intervene on behalf of the Whites in exchange for the recognition of the treaty of Brest-Litovsk. By September 1921, both Moscow and St. Petersburg fell to the White forces and a new Russian Republic was established in the old Imperial capital of St. Petersburg. For the past fifteen years the leading parties, the Social Revolutionaries and Kadets, have governed in an uneasy coalition under Kerensky, maintaining their power through electoral manipulation and a lack of serious political opposition.  But Russia is becoming increasingly unstable, and other political forces are growing, and considering that it is now time for a change, so that the country may once again assert its power in the world...

Since its declaration of independence from Spain in 1821, El Salvador has been sharply divided between liberal and conservative factions that would leave it as disunited as most of the other Central American states. Despite several abandoned attempts to create a federal state with the other Central American countries, El Salvador has remained independent and easily influenced by foreign powers. Indeed, one of the most powerful influences in its history has been the foreign owned coffee industry. A drastic fall in the price of coffee during the great depression would lead to a minor communist insurrection in 1932. In reaction to this insurrection the military seized power and launched a series of reprisals that would claim the lives of over 20,000 Salvadorans. The new President, General Maximiliano Hernandez Martinez would launch a program that can only be described as limited liberalization combined with absolute repression. Though Martinez would never take on the elites of Salvadoran society, he did institute limited land reform and social welfare. A fervent anti-communist, he was sympathetic to the fascist cause, but also deeply aware that the US is much, much closer. The Generalissimo was also known for his spiritualism, which culminated in his stringing lights through San Salvador in an effort to ward off an epidemic of smallpox.
French: Le Salvador se libère officiellement de l’emprise espagnole en 1921. Comme pour la plupart de ses voisins, l’indépendance a engendré dans le pays des conflits opposant mouvements libéraux et conservateurs. Le Salvador essaie à plusieurs reprises de créer un Etat fédéral en s’unissant à d’autres pays d’Amérique centrale. Toutes ses tentatives se soldent toutefois par un échec, laissant le jeune pays en proie aux influences étrangères. La principale influence que subit le pays est imposée par les propriétaires étrangers de l’industrie du café. La chute des prix du café pendant la Grande Dépression est à l’origine d’une révolte communiste en 1932. Les militaires contrecarrent la révolte en accaparant le pouvoir et lancent un programme de représailles qui coûtera la vie plus de 20000 Salvadoriens. Le général Maximiliano Hernandez Martinez, nouveau président du pays, lance un programme politique qui combine la réduction  des libertés civiques à la répression absolue.  Bien que Martinez rechigne à s’attaquer aux élites salvadoriennes, il finit par procéder à des réformes terriennes et établit un système de sécurité sociale. En tant qu’anti-communiste primaire, il se sent proche de la cause fasciste mais reste conscient de la très grande proximité des Etats-Unis. Le généralissimo est également célèbre pour sa pratique du spiritisme dont l’une des principales manifestations a consisté à accrocher des lampions dans toute la ville de San Salvador dans le but de parer à une épidémie de petite vérole.
Italian: Dopo la dichiarazione d'indipendenza dalla Spagna (1821), El Salvador si è trovato bruscamente diviso fra fazioni liberali e conservatrici, che l'avrebbero lasciato disunito come la maggior parte degli altri stati dell'America Centrale. Nonostante diversi tentativi isolati di creare uno stato federale con gli altri paesi centroamericani, El Salvador conservò la propria indipendenza e fu facilmente influenzato dalle potenze straniere. Effettivamente, una delle più potenti influenze nella sua storia fu la presenza di una industria del caffè posseduta da stranieri. Una drastica caduta del prezzo del caffè durante la grande depressione, portò a una piccola insurrezione comunista nel 1932. In risposta a questa insurrezione, i militari presero il potere e lanciarono una serie di rappresaglie che causarono la morte di 20.000 salvadoregni. Il nuovo presidente, il generale Maximiliano Hernandez Martinez, avviò un programma che poteva essere descritto solamente come una sorta di apparente liberalizzazione, negata da una repressione assoluta. Anche se Martinez non sarebbe mai andato contro l'elite della società salvadoregna, egli attuò riforme della terra e per il benessere sociale limitate. Essendo un fervente anticomunista, Martinez simpatizzava per la causa fascista, ma era anche consapevole dell'estrema vicinanza degli Stati Uniti. Il Generalissimo era noto anche per il suo spiritualismo, che culminò con l'affissione di una serie di luci per San Salvador nel tentativo di cacciare un'epidemia di vaiolo.
Spanish: Desde su declaración de independencia de España en 1821, El Salvador ha estado claramente dividido en facciones liberales y conservadoras que lo dejarían tan desunido como la mayoría de los demás estados centroamericanos. Pese a varios intentos abandonados de crear un estado federal con los otros países centroamericanos, El Salvador ha seguido siendo independiente y especialmente vulnerable a influencias de potencias extranjeras. De hecho, una de las más poderosas de su historia ha sido la industria cafetera, en manos extranjeras. Una drástica caída del precio del café durante la Gran Depresión llevaría a una insurrección comunista en 1932, poco trascendente. Reaccionando a esta rebelión, el ejército se hizo con el poder y lanzó una serie de represalias que costarían la vida a más de 20.000 salvadoreños. El nuevo presidente, el general Maximiliano Hernández Martínez, inició un programa de algo que no puede describirse más que como una liberalización limitada con una represión absoluta. Aunque Martínez nunca se enfrentaría a la elite de la sociedad salvadoreña, sí que instauró una reforma agraria restringida y una seguridad social. El general era un ferviente anticomunista que simpatizaba con la causa fascista, pero también era consciente de que los Estados Unidos estaban muchísimo más cerca. El Generalísimo también era conocido por su afición al espiritismo, que culminó con la instalación de cadenas de luces por todo San Salvador en un intento de parar una epidemia de viruela.
German: Seit der Erklärung seiner Unabhängigkeit von Spanien im Jahre 1821 gibt es in El Salvador eine scharfe Trennung zwischen den liberalen und konservativen Fraktionen, wodurch es genauso zersplittert ist wie die meisten anderen zentralamerikanischen Staaten. Trotz mehrerer aufgegebener Versuche, mit anderen Staaten Zentralamerikas einen Bundesstaat zu gründen, ist El Salvador weiterhin unabhängig und lässt sich leicht von ausländischen Mächten beeinflussen. Tatsächlich stellt die Kaffeeindustrie, die sich in ausländischer Hand befindet, einen der größten Einflussfaktoren in seiner Geschichte dar. Ein drastischer Preisverfall für Kaffee im Zuge der Großen Depression führte 1932 zu einem kleineren Aufstand der Kommunisten. Als Reaktion auf diesen Aufstand riss das Militär die Macht an sich. Die folgenden Repressalien forderten das Leben von über 20.000 Salvadorianern. Der neue Präsident, General Maximiliano Hernandez Martinez, startete ein Programm, das wohl nur als “eingeschränkte Befreiung bei absoluter Unterdrückung” beschrieben werden kann. Obwohl sich Martinez niemals mit der Elite der salvadorianischen Gesellschaft anlegte, leitete er dennoch eine limitierte Landreform und ein Sozialsystem ein. Als fanatischer Gegner des Kommunismus sympathisierte er mit dem Faschismus, war sich jedoch der geografischen Lage zu den USA mehr als bewusst. Der Generalissimus war außerdem für seinen Spiritismus bekannt, der darin gipfelte, dass er ganz San Salvador zum Aufhalten einer Pockenepidemie mit aufgereihten Lichtern erleuchten ließ.
